risk: It’s never easy making an independent film, especially one with dark, difficult subject matter like ours. More and more the film industry is looking to produce generic and risk-averse marketing campaigns where the movies are an after-thought. But Kickstarter gives you, the audience, the opportunity to short-circuit that. I came to New York City in the early 1980s, the time of punk rock. In rundown lofts and tenements, artists, filmmakers and musicians challenged the status quo and embraced the complexity of life. From out of my experiences in 1980s New York, I learned to embrace risk and it has informed every project I’ve worked on subsequently – whether it was subverting the gaze in my first feature, VARIETY, a film shot at a porn theater, or exploring the taboos in a mother-son relationship in LUMINOUS MOTION. This project, BORDER CROSSING, is no different.

risk: Faux Paz is a 17-member ensemble comprised of full-time undergraduate students from a variety of disciplines across the University of Maryland. This competition is a culmination of our hard work from this year and all the efforts from all 22 years of our history. Competing on this international level, we have the honor of representing the University of Maryland. As college students, academics are our priority; however, we all devote much of our spare time to creating this musical experience.  We face the challenges of time management, budgeting our limited funds, and transporting such a large group of people. Unfortunately, our Student Government Association does not assist with travel expenses or lodging, our two main expenses for this trip. risk: We know the game is ambitious, so we have an iterative development in mind: the game will be released in stages. The first release will be consist of a main hub with three rides, and will feature multiple avatar interactions. Then every other month, the game will be updated with new rides and features, like personal space customization and an avatar editing, but also ride editors, and the ability to upload your own photos and designs into the game world.

The Kickstarter will only finance the development of the first iteration. The following updates will be financed by in-game commerce.This way we minimize the risk, by getting your impressions early on: your feedback will help us prioritize the features and improvements of each update.

Virtual reality (VR) headset are not available commercially yet. So, even though we will support the technology, our gameplay is not reliant on it. We’ll release the game without VR initially, and incorporate VR once it's been tested. Having said that, we chose a rendering engine (Unreal Engine 4) that is the most advanced to support VR.

risk: INDE is a new team. We have a lot of good ideas and sound planning, but this is our first attempt at crowd funding. While we’re going to try to keep bumps in the road to a minimum, we’re definitely going to encounter our share of challenges.

Printing the book is our first challenge. We have a printer lined up and ready to go and the core systems of the book are complete, but our primary risk comes with the logistics of shipping and shipping on time. That said, we plan to be completely transparent about our production process and will involve you each step along the way.

We intend on sending the game to print in 8 to 12 months after the Kickstarter ends and expect to get it from the printer a few months later, finally shipping to backers 3-4 weeks after that. This timeframe will allows us to account for mishaps while ensuring that the quality of the book will meet or exceed expectations. In addition, this allows for our launch party where the staff will sign books.

risk: We completed our first CD project in 2013 on time and on budget. That debut CD was a runaway hit, selling out within 6 weeks of initial delivery.

We have more than 14 years of experience producing live music, rehearsing and performing weekly throughout the fall and spring seasons. We've recently performed at the National September 11 Memorial and Museum.

One challenge we face is securing a recording studio. Our home rehearsal studio, Manhattan Theatre Club, is not designed as a recording facility. This campaign will help us secure funds for rental of a modest recording studio which will help us produce a high-quality CD. Another minor challenge is to secure a mechanical reproduction license for a few songs that are not in the public domain. This is a small portion of the project budget, about  $500.00. We have already been in touch with BMI and the Harry Fox Agency to obtain terms for the proper license.

The choir is self-managed by a dedicated core group that includes professional singers, musicians, designers, marketers, programmers and community activists. We are supported by a hands-on Board of Directors who never fail to roll up their sleeves to help us in times of need. Together the choir membership and the Board set realistic goals and make sure to follow-through. That's why we have endured since 2001 and are now 60 members strong.

Challenges include getting needing to find paid work as well, while I continue to support my brother logistically. This project may help me find photography work in this area, which could be and needs to be flexible enough to allow for this project (second), and my brother's support (first).

Other less serious challenges include delivering additional multiple images in a variety of photographic styles I'm not yet adept in or for which I don't yet have the equipment. The latter will be taken care of by this fundraiser. For the former, I've been studying at every slow moment, taking many online classes, in-person seminars, and tapping every possible mentor. I study photography science, Photoshop, Lightroom, etcetera, and I stay current in my '50 Self Assignments Per Year' challenge.
This project has been an incredible inspiration. No matter how far it goes, it will have changed my life for the better. And watching my brother enjoy doing it is priceless.

risk: Because there are so many moving parts and variables in film, there will always be obstacles. That is why the producer and director are working hard to keep everything as simple and efficient as possible. Most of our locations are set and our equipment is ready to go, but since we live in the Northwest, the weather can change from one hour to the next, and since we will only be able to film one or two days per week, set backs can set us back quite a bit. That being said, we have given ourselves enough time to ensure that we have some flexibility with this and that everything can still be accomplished in a timely fashion. We have a small team of people working on Yellow, but we will make sure to stay in touch with all of you to ensure that you always know what is going on. If there is ever something you need please do not hesitate to contact us.

blurb1: Vi gör en granskande dokumentär om Copyswede. We are making a documentary about the Swedish organisation Copyswede.
title: COPYGATE - A documentary about Copyswede
risk: Making a documentary can be a hard and time consuming process. We are fully aware of problems that can and will occur. Our experience is that with a clear budget, timetable and overhead, a lot can be accomplished in time and without any major problems.
With our experience we will limit potential problems to a minimum and take necessary steps in order to secure some of the most common issues.

1. Raid and double hard drives for all information, interviews and edits made.
2. We will only work with experienced team members.
3. An overhead has been applied to all costs in the budget.
4. Planning all steps of the process.

A successful Kickstarter campaign will make a huge difference for the debate around the private copying law in Sweden and will raise awareness about Copyswede. The more supporters we get, the stronger the message will be to the community and lawmakers in Sweden, Scandinavia and Europe.

risk: No one wants to see a good idea executed poorly, especially us. We have worked extremely hard to ready this product for Kickstarter. We have lined up full-scale manufacturing and fulfillment, but here are what we see as the risks:

MANUFACTURING: Creating the tooling to manufacture a small electronics product and ensure durability is expensive and requires expert knowledge to get it right. To minimize risk we're working with manufacturing partners in the U.S. with a track record for quality.

PRODUCT ADJUSTMENTS: As PocketLab gets geared up for production, there will likely be some minor adjustments to improve the final product. Pre-production prototypes are made to test and refine the product and allow us to incorporate our adjustments and those suggested by experienced manufacturing partners. These will always be for the benefit of you, the consumer, and we will let you know exactly how and why any changes are made.

FULFILLMENT: Sometimes things go awry that can’t be planned for: a supplier misses a deadline, a machine breaks down, or a shipment gets lost. Those things could cause delays. To minimize the possibility of manufacturing setbacks we will enter the manufacturing stage with at least one back-up supplier for each component pre-located and our product commercialization experts will help ensure smooth sailing from our suppliers and factories.

We will be working with manufacturers who have years of experience delivering excellent products in tremendous quantities. There will no doubt be some surprises along the road, but any obstacle will be addressed by combining our internal knowledge with external expertise, and an overall goal of making the best possible product for you, our fellow explorer.

Any pledge amount brings us one step closer to our goal. Start exploring with us by clicking the ‘Back This Project’ button at the top of the page, or by helping us spread the word by sharing our page.
We can't wait to start changing the world.  We will build each PocketLab in your honor, and say THANK YOU for your help!

You'll be invited (with up to two friends) to a weekend of gaming with me in the New York area. Room and board will be provided for three days and two nights as we game our sanity away. We'll determine a date that works for both of us (transportation costs not covered). Plus the Austere Tutelar rewards.
risk: With the sheer amount of material ready to go in this book, the only risk is unforeseen delays in production and shipping. I've given a generous amount of time to get everything finished, so if anything I expect to get the book finished and rewards out ahead of the above schedule. Still, I'll be giving regular written and video updates to keep everyone briefed on the process.

As I said above, I'm already in contact with many artists whose work has been seen in Magic: the Gathering, Legend of the Cryptids, and Fantasy Flight Games, so we're locked and loaded. All we need is the funding to put art and words together. Then we can print it and get it onto your game tables.

There may be those of you who have given creators money only to watch helplessly as things ground to a halt. I just want to say that I'm aware of situations like this and will be especially conscientious about updates and news. If things get tough or behind schedule you'll be the first to know. Luckily most of the grunt-work for this project is already complete. You can trust me to see it to the end. I've literally spent more than a thousand hours on this book. I'm not going to gas out now.
Darkplane has always been a gift I've shared with my friends. Now with your help I can share it with the world. Let's do this together. Thanks for your support!

risk: As with anything in life, there are inherent risks associated with publishing a board game. Shipping can delay any scheduled production deadline. Another risk may include games that are packaged incompletely or more than they should be. If this should happen contact me and I will work with the manufacturer to make sure it is made right. blurb1: The Intervention follow the chaos that ensues after a family misconstrues their son's attempt to hang himself with erotic asphyxiation.

reward_backer_tup: You're either Tom's parents, Warren Buffet, or just a genuinely good-hearted person with a passionate for the arts (not that those are mutually exclusive). Please accept all of the above perks, plus an executive producer's credit on the film. Tom will also take you out to an intimate dinner in Greenwich Village.*
risk: At first glance, The Intervention appears at best controversial, and at worst downright offensive. We understand your apprehension. Suicide is a sensitive subject and recently at the forefront of contemporary cultural dialogue. Throwing erotic asphyxiation into the mix digs can only dig us into a deeper hole, right?

We like to think the opposite. By engaging our audience with a clever, if morbid, premise we believe we can tell the story that deserves to be told, which is at heart about a boy's struggle to find validation despite the harsh realities of modern home-life and media saturation

We have a powerful script, one we feel so strongly about that we only want to make a reality if we can do it justice. Your generous donations won't be going towards superfluous special effects and other bells and whistles, but rather towards making sure we achieve a competitive level of production quality as well as support for our cast and crew.

blurb1: A multi-media, immersive contemporary dance work that explores artistic ownership through street art. May 15-17, RIFT Blackbox Theater.
title: [re]CLAIM
reward_backer_tup: Every bit helps us meet our goal.
LOCALS DEAL: Get one pre-sale ticket to [re]CLAIM at the Rift Blackbox Theater in Miami and receive one Nazmo Dance Collective coaster at the door.
Receive a streaming link of the performance the day after our last show.

Watch the performance streamed LIVE from your home computer and receive two Nazmo Dance Collective coasters.
BRONZE LEVEL: Watch the performance streamed LIVE from your home computer, receive two Nazmo Dance Collective coasters, and get behind-the-scenes video updates via email.

GOLD LEVEL: Receive a DVD of [re]CLAIM and a digital download link, plus, watch the performance streamed LIVE from your home computer, receive two Nazmo Dance Collective coasters, and get behind-the-scenes video updates via email.
risk: [re]CLAIM is a project that we have been working on for almost two years and now we are ready to turn it into a full-length production. With [re]CLAIM, Nazmo Dance Collective is moving outside the box. We are working with emerging mediums and structures in order to find new and more meaningful ways to connect to audiences. In previous years, Nazmo Dance Collective has worked on a smaller scale, producing quality work through small individual monetary and in-kind donations. These smaller productions have allowed the company to grow with success. In order to continue growing, reach new audiences and begin producing larger-scale work that does not sacrifice quality, WE NEED YOUR HELP. The performance of [re]CLAIM will be a full evening length production and requires upwards of 60 hours of rehearsal and preparation from the dancers and choreographer. The project calls for collaboration with many different artists including graffiti artists, hip hop artists, filmmakers, animators and a composer and without your support, it cannot happen.
Where does your money go?

Nazmo Dance Collective is excited to announce that we received a grant from Miami Dade County Cultural Affairs for $5000. We need you to help match this grant and raise our total budget of $10,000. Your contribution will go towards any of the following costs:

4 dancers = $900 each for rehearsals and performances
3 Urban Artists = $230 each for workshops and created art 
1 choreographer = $300
1 graphic designer = $1000 for live animation and projection design
1 composer = $300
1 costume designer + costume costs = $250
1 photographer/videographer = $250
2 production assistants = $150
set + materials = $250
1 projector = $300
70 hours of space rental for performances, workshops and rehearsals = $1550 
marketing costs = $1350
All contributions are tax-deductible.
Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate, please spread the word about Nazmo Dance Collective and [re]CLAIM. More information can be found at our website, www.DanielleKipnis.com. You can also support us by attending a performance and/or free workshop. Please contact NazmoDanceCollective@gmail.com for any further questions or comments.

risk: The risks are minor. The game is done, it's established, and it's refined through years of development and playtesting. Manufacturing and fulfillment have already been arranged. The challenge will be drawing enough of the right attention to the game so that we can reach our goal.

Once our goal has been reached everything will come together quickly and efficiently. Manufacturing does take time though, so we will be able to deliver the games to you in a reasonable period of time. We look forward to fulfilling your orders!
Question and Answer:

Q: Who will be handling the manufacturing?
A: WinGo Game Manufacturing.

Q: Who will be handling fulfillment?
A: Amazon for the USA, Spiral Galaxy will likely handle UK/Euro fulfillment, and I will personally handle fulfillment in Canada.

Q: Are you Sean MacDonald, designer of The Crow and the Pitcher?
A: No, I'm Sean McDonald, not MacDonald. Our first and last name are very common, but we are not the same person.

Q: Why offer an 'Early Backer Bonus'?
A: Though we may have established a good backer community from our previous KS, we're still fairly new to the board game scene. Early backers are incredibly important in demonstrating to others that this game is going to be supported and funded. Additionally, we are aiming for a loftier goal in order to bring a higher quality product to you right as soon as the game is funded. This means we greatly need starting momentum early in the campaign. No matter how good a product is, if potential backers don't see support for it they in turn will likely pass right by it as the campaign matures. Our hope is that backers that missed out on this Early Backer Bonus offer understand this, and do not feel left out by knowing our intention is not to upset them but merely to get the game to them. We acknowledge that your pledge is supporting the campaign to a greater degree, and we truly thank you for it.

Q: Can Train Heist be played solo, with just one player?
A: Though the game is designed with 2-4 players in mind, like most co-operative board games it can be played solitaire. Special 'Solo Play' punchboard tokens will be included that will assist players in playing a mock 2-4 player game by themselves, playing as all characters. The tokens will be color-coordinated to match the cowboy pieces, so that Poker Hands and Loot/Bullet Tokens can be kept in order, and will be numbered so player order can be kept track of.

Q: Will your Stretch Goals eventually add anything to the game itself?
A: Future Stretch Goals, should funding continue, will include further component upgrades such as box or insert upgrades, etc. No more game components will be added, but merely upgraded. We want to make our backers aware the game they are receiving upon funding is already a complete and high quality game. We will not cancel the project merely because it doesn't reach a certain Stretch Goal we had in mind initially, as is a recent trend on Kickstarter. That would be a highly dishonest and deceitful method of tricking backers into thinking they're getting more game for their dollar by using Stretch Goals, when in reality the Stretch Goals are adding necessary components always intended for the game. Tower Guard Games does not condone this and feels this harms the Kickstarter community and crowd-funding in general, and that is why we want to be forthright and honest to our backers in this regard.

Q: Why did you use animals over humans?
A: A game's art should represent the nature of the game. Elements of the game lend themselves to a more exaggerated, almost cartoon-like view of the American "Wild West", and thus the game wasn't meant to take itself seriously (i.e. at points during the game the train leaves the board and pops out on the other side). To avoid gamers approaching this game in that manner and being disappointed, I decided to have a more light- hearted approach to the art, while keeping a gritty feel. This gives a good general context to those approaching this game for the first time. That said, if given enough demand, who knows what the future brings?

risk: I've made two other films that take place during the Civil War. I have also made four additional short films that have played at various festivals. This gives me an average of two films produced per year since I started making films three years ago. I take the necessary time to study and do research for my scripts before putting them into production. I care deeply for the writing process and strive to build characters to which you can relate and empathize with.

On all of the films I've made, but especially the period pieces, there are many logistical challenges during every phase of production. I thrive on these challenges, and they make seeing the final film that much more rewarding. With Civil, we will need authentic locations, wardrobe, and props. This is where most of the funding for this film will be deposited. The rest of the money will go to treating my actors and crew fairly for their services. Although the script is only about six pages, months of work will be put into making this script go to camera.

Please enjoy the perks listed on this page, as with every donation, you get something neat in return. I will put together all of your rewards personally, and I sincerely thank you for your contribution.

risk: Dun, Dun, Duuun. The big risks and challenges segment of the page. Yes, anytime you make a film, there will be risks. The first thing they teach you in any business class is higher risk, higher return. The only risk that you take on your end is investing, but not getting to watch the final product because the film goes unmade. If we can’t raise the funds, your amazing donation will go unused. In other words, the higher risk in our project (the more you help us out), the higher the return (the better the movie will turn out). So many amazing films have been made on small budgets and our team is confident this film can enter that category.

The plan is shoot over the course of a few days in May 2015 and then enter post-production in the weeks that follow. Moreover, it’s possible that shooting days might be postponed barring inclement weather. Much of our film takes place outside. If there’s inclement weather, we’ll have no choice but to defer the day of shooting to another date.
The rewards will be sent out as soon as the film is finished shooting. Making a movie at any size is no walk-in-the-park. It’ll only be possible if you can help us out.
We want to thank everyone who believes in us enough to make this short film a reality.

risk: Once we are funded, the greatest challenge we will face is the festival circuit. Not only is it expensive to submit to festivals, but it's even more expensive to attend them. On top of that, films with no big name stars have a hard time hitting the circuit hard. For that reason, we are trying to raise as much money as possible in order to raise the production value.
While the director and the crew are used to making low-budget projects look expensive, the more we can get, the better the film will look and sound.
The festival circuit is where the film will find its distribution, and that will be the largest hurdle to jump.

risk: - CNC Milling Services: Last year we learned its financially safer to get a written work order of all the costs before they start working.
-Storage: This year we are asking the Milling Service to store the effigy at their warehouse so we have more space to test build and check for missing parts to save time.

-Assembly: We do 2 test builds.  One is a mockup of 20 parts to check the lap joint tightness.  2nd is a full test in a warehouse to organize the parts by part # and see how long it takes volunteers to assemble and learn short cuts.
-Stability: We used rope to over-stablize the structure last year.  This year we plan to find flatter ground and use levellers to ensure the most stable and safe build.
-Height limit: We reduced the height to limit the amount of ladder work needed since we must minimize build time during the 3 day event.
-Fire Saftey:  Volunteers create a saftey permiter around the effigy and keep extinguishers and fire blankets near by.  We only use kerosense as the primary fuel on a base of firewood.

risk:
RISK TO THOSE PLEDGING FOR A FINE ART PRINT
There is no risk at all to those who pledge for a fine art print.  All of the art prints you can choose from are ready to go, so once the campaign is over you are guaranteed to get your fine art print as soon as possible. Remember prints are available on a first pledge first serve basis.  It is possible that the photo you want could sell out but the chance of this happening is unlikely. That being said it's a good idea to  have a second choice in mind.

RISK TO THOSE PLEDGING FOR A FINAL COPY OF THE BOOK
Those who pledge for a copy of the final book also have minimal risk.  I have priced the books at a rate so that I can afford to have a short run of very special edition books just for you.  This is included in my budget.  I will probably run another kickstarter to raise money for mass production of the BARE USA book once I have photographed all of the states but this has no bearing on current backers. The biggest risk here is completing the project as a whole, which I explain in greater detail below.

RISK TO THOSE WHO PLEDGE TO SPONSOR A STATE
The biggest risk here is that you are not able to sponsor the state you had hoped for.  The sponsor a state options is on a first pledge basis meaning those who pledge first get first choice on the available states.  Once a state is sponsored is no longer available to anyone else. All websites and social media outlets are in place and running smoothly, gaining more traffic every day so your shout outs are sure to be heard loud and clear.  The other risks are the same as those stated above and below.

RISK OF PROJECT COMPLETION 
The risk of not completing the project is minimal.  There are many challenges but little risk.  There may be locations I am unable to shoot at but there are an abundance of abandoned locations in every state so an alternative is always available.  There is no shortage of models interested in participating in this project so if one should cancel there are always others available.
If my truck breaks down I will fix it.
Should I be injured during my exploration of these somewhat dangerous structures, I will heal and I will continue on. I do have health insurance.

MY PERSONAL GUARANTEE 
The biggest assurance for the completion of this project is my drive.  Nothing will stop me from seeing this project all the way through.

risk: Dsenyo has been working with artisans groups for over six years and has successfully established partnerships in Malawi, Zambia and Brazil.  The Zambia artisan partnership was launched last year and this campaign is to expand that partnership by introducing a new snare wire jewelry line.  We believe that with help from our Kickstarter backers we will be strengthened in our ability to successfully maintain and expand the Zambia partnership. In reality, there are always challenges that come with working internationally, in rural communities and in a developing country.  We are familiar with these ups and downs and are prepared to overcome them as we have been able to do in the past.  Here are some specific challenges we foresee:
EXCEEDING OUR GOAL

Kickstarter projects have the potential to go viral and far exceed their goal.  We certainly hope ours does!  In general, this only means more good for the essential anti-poaching work we are supporting and the employment created for women and artisans crafting the jewelry.  We plan to get rewards out to backers by Mother’s Day 2015.  However, if the campaign takes off we will notify you on this site about any shipping delays.
INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING CHALLENGES

We have already been successfully importing from this artisan group in Zambia.  This means that we have our Fish & Wildlife License (designs contain freshwater pearl, shell and leather). Some of the jewelry is already in production in anticipation of campaign support and have built in enough time for the customs clearing process.
GETTING PRODUCT TO OUR SUPPORTERS
We will be shipping all of our rewards out with tracking information so we can keep you updated on its estimated arrival time.
FAIR TRADE COMMITMENT
Dsenyo is a member of the Fair Trade Federation.  We are committed to social change, inspired design, fair trade principles, and responsible business practices.

title: Uprooted Flower Truck - NYC Launch
risk: One of the biggest challenges Uprooted will face is finding our customers. People buy flowers for particular events but they are also often an “impulse buy.” The problem with impulse buying in NYC is once you've bought something, you have to trek it home over the river and through the streets. Although Uprooted's bouquets are travel ready, we still need to catch people who are headed home or to the event for which they need flowers. So we’ll need your help!! Let us know where you want Uprooted to be! As our business develops, we will need to listen to our clients’ needs and adapt our practices to provide NYC with fresh flowers!

Another major challenge will be balancing how much inventory to keep on the truck. Our generator can run on gas and electricity so that the cooler can be plugged in overnight. This feature will facilitate turnover of product from day to day, but part of Uprooted’s mission is to reduce waste by keeping a smaller inventory on the truck, so determining how much to purchase and when will be tricky. We want to have enough blooms for everyone who stops by the truck, but we also don’t want to be throwing lots of flowers away! Unfortunately, this will be a trial and error process, which is part of the reason we need help with operating costs. Uprooted needs the cushion Kickstarter will provide to allow for experimentation with truck location and inventory management.

Our limited inventory concept is also a risk. We may be alienating customers who are looking for a specific type of flower or have strong color preferences. Uprooted hopes to convert the naysayers by introducing them to new varieties and playful designs. We want people to branch out! Lilies may be your favorite flower, but if Uprooted is on your way to work, you may get dahlias this week and realize you love them on your desk too!

Overall, our biggest challenge is getting the word out so people know New York is getting its first florist on wheels – help us spread the word and put people on the look-out for Uprooted Flower Truck!

risk: Producing a run of 1000 physical copies of a comic book inherently presents challenges and there is always the possibility of something going wrong. The good news is that after 2 and a half years of making comics and successfully navigating the printing/shipping process for 3 previous comics, we’re pretty well equipped to deal with any hiccups that might arise. We’re on schedule for copies to ship by the end of July and we’re happy to be working with the reliable folks at PrintNinja (who’ve given us quality products on time before). We also believe in keeping the lines of communication open, so we’ll keep you updated on the process start to finish and if any issue that affected shipping dates were to come up, we’d keep you well informed of the situation!

reward_backer_tup: You will receive the personal satisfaction that you donated to the project

BLUE MORPHO BUTTERFLY, $25-50 USD:

- You will be sent a certificate of sponsorship online that you can print or keep for your records

HARPY EAGLE TITLE SPONSOR, $1000+ USD:

-  You will receive a fine art print to display of images from the final mural
-  Your contribution will be highlighted in all promotional literature and on our Facebook page
-  Your business’ information will be sent with all press releases
-  You will be publicly thanked at our Unveiling Ceremony on November 13th
- You will be sent a certificate of sponsorship online that you can print or keep for your records
risk: The main challenge for this project is to secure funding by April 14th so we may complete the painting and installation of the mural over a two month period. The time line is very tight but the students are currently working hard to generate ideas from the community. A digital design will be created that will make this process much easier and allow more people to participate.  Luckily Mr. Abel Flores (architect /contractor), Mr. Lizarraga (donating 35 bags of cement for plastering) and the town council in Belize are helping to get the wall plastered and primed so we can begin painting in May. The Anglican church his providing us with a studio to paint right across from the location and community members are helping to find me housing during my stay. I have also put in a request to Avainca airlines to help sponsor my travel. If we keep getting the support we need then this project will happen within the time constraints. Your help is needed!

risk:
What are the risks?
- We understand the challenge of filming 5 short films all at once, that’s why each project has its own Writer, Director, Producer, Cinematographer, and Editor to dedicate their time solely to one project.
- Each project has its own post-production film festival strategy, unique for that individual film. And Counterfeit Cow Productions will sponsor a private screening for all 5 films.
- Obstacles are inevitable in film making, which is why we have support from our community, and our professional and experienced WOP members.
- Counterfeit Cow Productions has been in business since 2011, so even though this is the first year for the Women Only Project, Counterfeit Cow productions is determined to see it through.

risk: The risks we face are similar to all projects like this. Did we budget correctly? Are we realistic in our timeline? What we CAN say is that if we raise the funds, we WILL complete the film. We've done it before and now that we know what we are doing, we can do it again. By nature, we are optimistic, else we would not even begin. The risk is that we are overly optimistic that we can get it done as quickly as we hope. Perhaps interviewees will not be available when we hope. Perhaps the right editor will be booked on another project. Perhaps the manufacturing companies will have a slow turnaround. When Luxury made "Trophies" we expected to have vinyl pressed at a certain facility. When we were ready to send the final master we asked what the turnaround was. Their answer was "6 months". So, we found a vinyl manufacturer in the Czech Republic who could do it in a little less than 3 months.  This is the most likely risk. No matter when we conservatively estimate that we will be finished, there are unknowns. Rest assured, though, when we are funded, we are committed to complete it. Hopefully on time.

blurb1: Help Gateway High School's Garden Club install automated drip irrigation for its large Urban Food Forest and Outdoor Classroom.
title: Gateway High School Garden Irrigation
reward_backer_tup: Reusable bag made by students with repurposed fabric

Free home garden consultation by a local landscape architect and certified permaculture designer.

risk: A garden needs water, especially in times of drought. An efficient drip irrigation system that delivers the proper amount of water to plants without any waste and evaporation requires careful planning. We've worked with two professional, local irrigation designers and installers (one is a Gateway parent!) to ensure the best design, including rain sensors to turn off the irrigation in wet weather and multiple watering zones and timers to water just the right amount and the right time of day. Students will be trained in the installation and maintenance of the lines, as well as the programming of timers. We've also got hose bibs planned throughout the garden to hook up to whenever we need running water.

On March 6, the organization Common Vision will visit our garden and together with our students plant 18 fruit trees! These trees will be a strong backbone of our food production and the primary shade source in our garden. If all goes to plan, the irrigation will be installed alongside the tree planting, so that Spring in the garden will be a place thriving with healthy new plants and trees, happily getting just the right amount of  water they need!

SUPERSTAR: Evan did a great job in that video, didn't he?  But you know who did an even better job? His sweater. Be a superstar like Evan by wearing Evan's sweater. This reward tier gets you all of the above, plus we'll send you Evan's sweater. (And who wouldn't want that awesome sweater in June?!)
risk: Quiplash may seem like a simple party game, but it's complicated by multiple platforms and lots of server technology.

- We have ambitious goals to expand the capabilities of our server-based systems and allow more active participants in our games than ever before. There are many hardware and software technologies at play in this complicated system and as we modify our architecture, unexpected challenges may present themselves.  In a worst-case scenario we could launch Quiplash with support for fewer than anticipated "audience participants" per game, but the good news is that if there are complications we can always continue to evolve this server back-end for additional player support after launch.

- Unlike other video games found on Kickstarter which launch on PC first (or only) we're bringing Quiplash to console platforms as well.  There are rigorous submission and approval processes with each different console and depending on our experience through those approval processes, our intended launch could be delayed.

- There is a lot of content for us to create. We're aiming for hundreds and hundreds of prompts in the game and we need to write, edit, and record all of that content in a short period of time. Thankfully, we have lots of experience doing this (i.e. YOU DON'T KNOW JACK, Fibbage, Drawful) and with your backing we can ramp up the resources we need.
We're excited to get Quiplash in your hands and we're confident you'll have tons of fun with the game when we launch it.  So please support Quiplash, spread the news, and join us on our journey!

blurb1: please fund this unique card company. we offer cards in atypical genres coupling snarky humor and lovely art.
title: Inventive Invective Cards
reward_backer_tup: every dollar helps. and for any amount under the $25 tier you'll get a thank you on our official website, www.inventiveinvectivecards.com

risk: the scope of this project has been specifically crafted to minimize risks as much as possible. here are some risks along with my answer to said challenges:

- excess inventory: research shows that the biggest risk in the greeting card industry is getting stuck with excess inventory. to minimize this risk i have negotiated a deal with a local printer that allows me to print 50 cards per design to begin. the industry minimum is usually 100-150 units per design.

expensive overhead: there isn't any. i do everything and as of yet i do not receive a paycheck. i design the art, i write the jokes, i do the marketing, i run the website and i'll fill the orders. there is no fancy office or expensive equipment to buy. the costs are minimized by my willingness/ability to run a one-woman-show.

- difficult entry into market: i get it. hallmark reigns supreme. good thing i don't intend to compete with them. i have created a product with a niche audience in mind. i plan to sell my cards on my website, at fairs and flea markets in trendy neighborhoods and areas near colleges. in addition, I'll work to stock them in novelty gift/card shops, sex shops, and smoke shops. long term i'd like to get into a chain store, of course, but in the meantime i have created a directory of local shops that serve my niche and will contact them directly to become resellers.

- general amateur-ness: mistakes will be made. i anticipate that. but to minimize mistakes i have applied to the mentor program offered by the greeting card association. this association couples market veterans with newcomers to offer advice on such things as distribution, pricing, and marketing. although, since i've been in marketing for over a decade i think i'm off to a strong start. i am not starting a business out of the blue. i've already grown a start-up company successfully and now i want to do it for myself.

Murphy's law! Rest assured, minor set backs won't take long. I'm Army trained and a veterinarian. Thinking outside the box, being observant, and never quitting are some of my star attributes. risk: After going through one Kickstarter campaign and dealing with the failure to fund, our eyes are open wider now!  We learned a lot with that first campaign and it was a lot of hard work but it was a valuable experience.  We’ve carefully assessed our risks and challenges.
Risks:  The biggest risk is that we’re putting ourselves out there again.  These Kickstarter campaigns are a lot of work!

Challenges:  We lowered our goal, so that meant that we needed to streamline our budget.  We had to reassess the inventory we would need immediately.  This means that we won’t be able to make every tea imaginable right away.  We need to be smarter about the blend choices and the reblend choices.

We also had to reassess what equipment was crucial to make it work and which equipment we could put off buying for a while after we’ve made enough profits to reinvest in the company.  So it will be a challenge to operate without all of the equipment we had budgeted for with the first Kickstarter campaign, but, it can be done.  It will just be a little more hard work.  But we’re ready to work hard!

blurb1: Mary Blackwell, a young woman, is thrown into a horrific struggle against the ultimate evil, a supernatural being called Nazzrack.

reward_backer_tup: Thanks! All donations help, and you have our gratitude!

risk:
There are always risks when you are making a film, be it a six minute short or a sixty minute full-length. The biggest risk, and the one that occurs the most often, is scheduling mishaps. It is incredibly common for something to “come up” at the last possible second for anyone involved in the project, myself included, which could potentially cut in to the time you are supposed to be filming, and can result in major setbacks. To prevent this, I plan to have a full, detailed schedule of filming completed by early April, a full two months before filming, so that everyone is on the same page well in advance. 
        Another major risk is the risk of technological glitches. Sometimes cameras break, and you’re left without a way to shoot an essential scene. Sometimes computers crash, and that can result in losing days of precious filming. I plan to combat these unpredictable, yet preventable obstacles simply by being prepared. This is not my first film, and I have encountered many technological setbacks in my time as a film-maker. Because of this, I am prepared to deal with whatever life throws at me. 
        I feel that with my experience, combined with the experience of the many extremely talented people who will be helping to make this film a reality, we will be more than capable of handling any problems that come our way.

risk: Risks and challenges

Regards risks, Bob has already made the sculpts for this project, so we don't foresee any problems there. We will be using Griffin Moulds Ltd an experienced quality moulder and caster to provide castings of the sculpts, they have been responsible for my Olleys Armies miniatures castings for the last 8 years or more, so we know they are reliable and produce top quality metal castings. We have set a delivery date of July 2015, it's possible that we may be able to send out rewards before July, but we want to allow for the unforseen problems that might arise. Although it's very unlikely, sudden price increases in metal before we can fullfill the rewards would cause us a problem. Postage is a risk outside our control, items getting delayed or even lost, we will use Royal Mail or other reliable courier and we will keep a proof of postage. Orders with a replacement value over £20 will be sent signed for or tracked with increased insurance.

risk: We anticipate very few roadblocks in the way of completing this project on time. The biggest potential hazard, perhaps, is our reliance on old-school recording technology. The old tape machines - two-inch for recording, half-inch for mixing - are amazingly-built machines, however they require a good deal of care and maintenance to keep them running properly. Fortunately, The Studio has Dan Selim, a live-in technician who worked with Lou Whitney for years - he literally lives above the studio. A worst-case scenario is that we may have to order a part for one of the machines, which might set us back 10 working days or so. Otherwise, our material is road-tested and Cindy and I have many, many collective hours of experience in the studio. Our visual and graphics artists are people with whom we have long professional and personal relationships. We are confident that barring an act of God, we will easily meet our projected release date of Tuesday, July 14, 2015.

risk: Game manufacturing and publishing contains a number of risks. A more likely threat, though less serious, is the possible delays involved. Dr. Finn's can mitigate both of these concerns. First, I will be using a manufacturer who has produced good results on game projects in the past. Second, Dr. Finn's Games has successfully completed each Kickstarter campaign on time (though we are presently in the end phase of the Biblios Dice campaign, but still on time) and understands how to keep the project on track. risk: J. Fred Woell: An American Vision will be the 17th film in this series of films on American artists sponsored by the Union of Maine Visual Artists, a 501(c)(3) not for profit educational organization.  All contributions are fully tax deductible.

There is no risk to this project being completed.  We have a track record that includes a New England Emmy nomination and a commitment for at least 10 films in the series to be marketed by American Public Television (APT) to the entire PBS affiliates.  Our most recently released documentary Imber's Left Hand about Jon Imber, the New England painter who lived a fulfilling life to the very end in spite of his deteriorating condition from ALS is bringing more attention to the rest of the series.  That film is now being distributed by Film Movement, a highly reputable distributor with a terrific track record that will help get that film seen by a very significant number of viewers.  And that will help propel the rest of the series into the limelight.

The challenge is raising the dollars to complete the J. Fred Woell film within the schedule that we have set for ourselves -- completion date  September 2016.  Another challenge is finding the financial backers who believe in Fred's vision of America -- a peaceful nation that demonstrates concern for social justice and environmental sensitivity.
So if you are one of those persons who believes in this vision and believes in the power of art to make a difference in the world, then this project is for you, at whatever financial level that fits.

risk: If there weren't any risks, it wouldn't be novel, original or any fun.

Moving from prototype to production is rarely easy but having the experience of bringing projects to production is not new to me. Doing this for the first time is always filled with unknowns, fortunately this is not my rodeo. I have built trust over the last 30 years working with reliable partners that deliver. We would rather have the chance to deliver your 3 in 1 Stand Up Stand earlier rather than later - just as we did with our Lumia Lamp and Franken Edison Light & VERSI Stand.

I am targeting delivery for April 2015 which allows us some time from when the project ends, funds are delivered and components ordered. I'd rather be honest from the start rather than annoying everyone with delays.

There might be slight design changes of which I will inform you.  The only design change at this time would be to change the rods from off white to black.  I think this will match the aesthetics of the anodized aluminum and black eyelets.
If you're in doubt drop me an email, I'll answer your questions.

risk: We would like to think that all our bases are covered, but here are what we see as the challenges:

MANUFACTURING: The molds would need adjusting and tweaking through the initial stages of production. To minimize the possibility of any mishaps and delays, we have partnered with a world leading manufacturer who is highly experienced at creating specialist molds. We have also included 1 whole month extra in our delivery timeline as a buffer for calibrating the new molds.

FULFILMENT: Shipping a large amount of orders in a short period of time can often lead to unexpected issues and delays. Luckily, Julian has had plenty of experience dealing with all kinds of shipping problems. He has shipped out tens of thousands of orders in the short span of a few weeks and knows exactly how to deliver a large amount of orders to customers with very few setbacks.
Any support you give us brings us closer to our goal. We don't plan to repay your kindness by producing a sub-par product or delivering months later than promised.
We are so happy and grateful to take you guys along this exciting journey with us. You guys are the real MVPs :)

risk: We have learnt a lot over the past 5 years of product development, manufacturing, marketing and everything else involved in business. We have learnt from any mistakes made in the past and are more aware of any pitfalls, so they can be avoided. This has shaped our new strategy to minimize the amount of risks. Getting reputable middle men to provide the solutions to manufacture abroad improves our chances of receiving a quality made product in bulk. The fact that we have already manufactured in the UK has meant that we have tweaked the design accordingly which now has to be translated to the manufacturers we go with. We have also been approached by a number of retailers, which shows a demand for the product commercially. However negotiations can't take place until we know the exact production costs.

You will receive ONE 2.0 Thread Wallet of your choice from our Kickstarter Collection
risk: When it comes to our product, the biggest challenge we could potentially face is being able to find a manufacturer that will perform quality/timely work. Fortunately we have teamed up with two excellent manufacturers in the United States, whom we have worked with in the past, and whom we can trust. We have also been making these wallets for the past year, so we have relationships with the suppliers who will provide all the materials for the wallets. As for shipping, we will team up with Shipstation.com to fulfill all orders. We are confident that we are sufficiently organized to perform all the necessary operations and/or to overcome any challenges that may come our way in order to produce this project as promised.

blurb1: A fully integrated 24/7 Global Prayer Service Website, helping people who are suffering worldwide to ask & receive  prayers immediately
title: Global Prayer Partners, Help Us Fulfill Prayers Worldwide!
reward_backer_tup: Moral Support!  Thanks for all of your help, for your donation.  For your donation you will receive a deep relaxation power nap mp3 from Kenji Kumara. Helping you channel the inner bliss, catnap style! Along with this you will also become a founding prayer partners, with a login an help answer prayers from fellow members worldwide!  Paying it forward in a big way!

For your pledge, we will be sending you an Mp3 from Tamra Oviatt, which will help you release any inner anger you are harboring towards God and the divine.  We have all felt "Why Me" at one point or another.  But now it's time to embrace ourselves and let go of that troubling anger! Along with being a founding Prayer Partner of course!

For your donation you will receive, Tamra Oviatt's Higher consciousness Mp3, helping you to heal your heart, and release any self judgements in equal measure.  Along with being a founding Prayer Partner of course!

For this reward level you will Receive Austin Muhs's e-book "Startup Fever, How Crowdfunding Will Rebuild the American Dream. What better way to start creating your reality than by crowdfunding your own unique project in 2015.  You will also be a founder on our Prayer Squad!

For your pledge We will give you a huge shoutout banner for a day on the homepage, showcasing a link to your own personal healing, coaching, or other prayer based service page!  We Want everyone to spread the healing love, so we can help promote one another! You will also be a Global Prayer Partner Founder!

Global Prayer Parntner Featured Member, For this donation you will get your own promotional page within the GPP website with which to promote your unique outside healing/coaching/teaching service.  With which you will be searchable, and able to directly message other members of the GPP community.

Founders Plus Package.  Besides just being a Featured Member, (see #8) you will also get all of the aforementioned perks from the previous packages. This includes all of the mp3's, the ebook, and the song!

In the event that you feel like paying it forward in a big way, we have put this promotional package together which will make you a permanent featured member on the GPP site. You will never have to pay annual renewal fees and we will provide you with 4 hour long expert marketing coaching sessions with which we can help you craft your page.  We will teach you how to maximize client referrals and pay it forward to get the very most of your GPP experience.  A great bargain for healers looking to monetizing their passion, by creating themselves a vocation!

Prayer Flight: For this donation we will take you on a guided 3 day prayer tour through a surprise area of the United States, where we will all volunteer and help out with a special community needs project. A project where prayer from the site will also be incorporated. Think of this as a once in a lifetime way to give back to those in need, while eating well in the proccess! All luxury accommodations will be provided once you arrive, but airfare isn't included. You will also get all of the aforementioned perks as well!
risk: Logistics and prayer scheduling and accountability are all constant moving targets.  We will be requiring people to fill out detailed reports about their background, and provide a list of character references so that we make sure we have the highest ethical standards in place for our prayer requests to be fulfilled. Social media is another large concern so we will be recruiting the best and the brightest around the social media profession so that we are staffed well according to prayer demand, and so that we can bring meaningful and tasteful request to those people who want mass notification via social media.

It may seem silly to some, but we want to make sure that when a preyer request goes out, that there is someone who is concerned and accountable waiting on the other end.  We pledge to never digress to mass prayers for groups of people, we want to focus on people individually as everyones request is important in our eyes.!

blurb1: Kits for learning electronics through hands-on activities including  making a space invaders game. Basic, Arduino and robotics kits.
title: The Jesseybug Electronics & Arduino Inventors' Kits
reward_backer_tup: Science Bug - A kit for doing 10 simple experiments involving a battery, LEDS and resistors.  The final experiment involves creating a "science bug" that you can wear to show off to others how you've caught the bug.

BuzzBott - The simplest and cheapest robot design that we could come up with.  This kit has the parts for creating a tiny robot that uses a coin battery for power, and moves by vibrating the bristles on a toothbrush head.  You will need to supply the toothbrush head.  This kit will contain the coin battery, the battery holder, and a tiny pager motor with an offset weight for vibrating.  You will want to have your own glue gun for putting this robot together.

CURRICULUM ONLY Early Sponsor option: We have had a request to make the curriculum available to prospective backers who already have access to electronics parts.  Those who back the Jesseybug project at $15 or more will have Beta access to all curriculum as it is developed, beginning in July (possibly sooner for the Simple Electronics and Basic Arduino kits).  These will be made available via online pdf and Google Presentations.  Those purchasing kits at $35 or more will also have access to the curriculum.
Set of 10 science bugs for use with smaller groups such as cub scouts, girl scouts, or clubs.

CURRICULUM ONLY option: We have had a request to make the curriculum available to prospective backers who already have access to electronics parts.  Those who back the Jesseybug project at $15 or more will have Beta access to all curriculum as it is developed, beginning in July (possibly sooner for the Simple Electronics and Basic Arduino kits).  These will be made available via online pdf and Google Presentations.  Those purchasing kits at $35 or more will also have access to the curriculum.

Simple Electronics - A kit for doing 25 electronics experiments.  These experiments teach the fundamentals of resistors, capacitors, transistors and ICs.  A favorite experiment for kids in this kit is the "Dark Detector."  This kit will include a book download (PDF) that shows you step-by-step how to do each of these experiments.  This kit is powered by a 9V battery.

Classroom Set: Science Bugs (30) 
This is a set of all of the parts for 30 of science bugs.  You will also get a link to download a PDF of a special version of the booklet that can be printed 4 at a time without having to collate the pages.  This set of kit will let you do an "hour of electronics" with an entire classroom of kids.

Basic Arduino, Early Sponsor - Our favorite electronics kit, this has been through 5 revisions, where we've identified our favorite parts to include.  This kit is based on the popular Arduino microcontroller, and includes all of the parts from the electronics kits, plus a LCD screen and more ICs for doing many more experiments.  With this kit you can do the original 25 experiments of the simple electronics kit, but will also be able to do an additional 25 more experiments that involve the Arduino, the LCD screen, and more digital ICs.  A favorite experiment of this kit is the "Space Invaders Game."  This kit will include a download for the two books (PDF) as well as the source code for the Arduino experiments.  Although this kit is powered by a 5 volt USB adapter, so you don't need to use a battery to do any of the experiments.

Basic Arduino - Our favorite electronics kit, this has been through 5 revisions, where we've identified our favorite parts to include.  This kit is based on the popular Arduino microcontroller, and includes all of the parts from the electronics kits, plus a LCD screen and more ICs for doing many more experiments.  With this kit you can do the original 25 experiments of the simple electronics kit, but will also be able to do an additional 25 more experiments that involve the Arduino, the LCD screen, and more digital ICs.  A favorite experiment of this kit is the "Space Invaders Game."  This kit will include a download for the two books (PDF) as well as the source code for the Arduino experiments.  Although this kit is powered by a 5 volt USB adapter, so you don't need to use a battery to do any of the experiments.

Arduino Plus -  We are having such a great opening day that we are adding 12 Arduino Plus kits at an Early Sponsor price of $70 (we have a few backers who have already pledged $70.  You will receive this kit). This kit will have all of the features of the basic kit, and then will include some additional hardware including an ultrasonic sensor, a servo motor,  and part of an RCA cable for doing 10 more experiments that start to introduce robotics.  This kit will include everything from the Basic Arduino kit, as well as the additional hardware, and a download of a book (PDF format) and software for the 10 additional experiments.

Arduino Plus - This kit will have all of the features of the basic kit, and then will include some additional hardware including an ultrasonic sensor, a servo motor,  and part of an RCA cable for doing 10 more experiments that start to introduce robotics.  This kit will include everything from the Basic Arduino kit, as well as the additional hardware, and a download of a book (PDF format) and software for the 10 additional experiments.

Robotic Arduino - This kit will have the items from the Arduino Plus kit, and then will add the additional hardware needed for building various robots.  This kit will include 2 stepper motors and driver boards, 2 additional servos, an IR receiver and controller, 2 2.4 GHz transceivers, and a bluetooth transceiver.  A favorite activity with this kit is to build a robot car that can be controlled from an Android tablet or phone.

Advanced Arduino - This kit has the components of all of the previous kits, and then includes parts for doing the advanced project of building two Arduinos from scratch.  These Arduinos can be embedded as a more permanent version of the previous projects or in projects of your own.  You will want to have your own soldering iron if you decide to get this kit.
Classroom/Club Set: Arduino Plus (5) - this is a set of 5 of the Arduino Plus kits for use with a classroom or club.

Ultimate Arduino - This kit has the components of all of the previous kits, and then includes all of our favorite add-on modules, including a 2.4" color TFT LCD screen that has a touch sensor on the front, an 8x8 RGB LED Matrix,  a USB Host Shield (for connecting USB WiFi or other devices to an Arduino), a GPS module, a Micro SD Board, a keypad LCD shield, a RF reader kit, and several other modules.  We've tried many of additional modules, and these are all of our favorites, and can be used for creating a wide variety of projects.  You will want to have your own soldering iron if you decide to get this kit.
risk: 1.  Finding reliable suppliers that can provide the parts on time, and for the low prices needed.  Having done this for 6 years, I'm very confident that I will be able to do this.
2.  Assembling the kits and shipping them out quickly.  If this Kickstarter results in too many orders for me to handle, we'll be hiring friends to help out.

3. Curriculum development: The basic curriculum has already been created for the Science Bugs and the Basic Electronics Kit.  I am still working on the curriculum for the more advanced kits.  It may take a little longer to get the PDFs of the more advanced kits ready to be used, but we plan on shipping the hardware on time, and then providing links to download the latest copy of the books as we update them.

blurb1: Chromacon is a free New Zealand Arts Festival that showcases illustrations, comics, animations, videogames & more from indie creatives.
title: Chromacon Indie Arts Festival 2015
reward_backer_tup: Original Art + The Chroma Super Combo!
[EXCLUSIVE] Original Art by JAW Cooper - Polar Bear
[EXCLUSIVE] Original Art by JAW Cooper - Stag
[EXCLUSIVE] Original Art by JAW Cooper - Tiger
[EXCLUSIVE] Unique hardcover CHROMA Vol.2 featuring original hand-drawn cover by JAW Cooper
[EXCLUSIVE] Unique hardcover CHROMA Vol.2 featuring original hand-drawn cover by Jacky Ke Jiang
[EXCLUSIVE] Unique hardcover CHROMA Vol.2 featuring original hand-drawn cover by Benjamin
[EXCLUSIVE] Unique hardcover CHROMA Vol.2 featuring original hand-drawn cover by Wenna
[EXCLUSIVE] Unique hardcover CHROMA Vol.2 featuring original hand-drawn cover by T-Wei
[EXCLUSIVE] Unique hardcover CHROMA Vol.2 featuring original hand-drawn cover by Jason Hong
[EXCLUSIVE] Unique hardcover CHROMA Vol.2 featuring original hand-drawn cover by Tom Monster (Tom Robinson)
[EXCLUSIVE] Unique hardcover CHROMA Vol.2 featuring original hand-drawn cover by Anna Johnstone
[EXCLUSIVE] Unique hardcover CHROMA Vol.2 featuring original hand-drawn cover by Allan Xia
risk: We are a small but dedicated team putting together a Festival and events around it - no stroll in the park!

Being a festival with many different components across many different mediums including artist exhibitors, live demonstrations, panels and talks, art competition, supporters' activations and international guests, it's a challenge to make sure all these things are pulled off without a hitch. Without the necessary support there's a risk that one of the great activities we have planned don't make it to the Festival.

Plus, one of the hurdles we face is getting the word out there and attracting  more people to the Festival. Therefore, we're looking to program the best content in order to present a diverse and exciting experience for festival-goers.

We value the creatives who join Chromacon and the people that take the time to come out and to engage with what's on offer at the Festival. We want to make sure that everyone has a good experience and creatives' work gets a chance to shine! So, we need people passionate about the arts to consider helping us out. We appreciate every contribution towards Chromacon!

blurb1: A powerful little drone synth you can get prebuilt or make yourself. Want a different synth? Just swap the chip for a different program
title: Hell Synth: DIY Digital Noise Terror
reward_backer_tup: My thanks, you are an awesome person.

My thanks, you are great, and a download including: 
9v Modular Junk Synth Software
and a EP's from me.
All of the above rewards and a professionally printed PCB of the "Hell Synth" with instruction and list of parts needed.
A build it yourself kit with all the parts you need and one pre programmed synth chip and PCB, instructions and all the downloads above.
A build it yourself kit with all the parts you need and BOTH pre-programed synth chips (3 different programs) and of corse the PCB, instructions and all the software downloads above.
A beautiful fully built "Hell Synth" with ONLY ONE program chip, plus all the digital content above.
A beautiful fully built "Hell Synth" with BOTH program chips, plus all the digital content above.
Two beautiful fully built "Hell Synths" with BOTH program chips, plus all the digital content above.
risk: The risks I've identified are:

OVERLOAD: Getting too many orders and not being able to field them all.
SOLUTION: The number of units being built are limited to a relatively small number, a maximum of 55 chips would need to be programmed in the event of a total sell out of all rewards.

PCB DELAY: The boards are delayed in being delivered to me.
SOLUTION: The company i have selected has an eight day manufacturing guarantee, if for any other reason they are unable to print the boards I have a range of alternative PCB manufacturers lined up.

blurb1: We are trying to put on an event to showcase the work of the final year Bespoke Tailoring students at London College of Fashion

reward_backer_tup: A copy of our Exhibition Catalogue, including acknowledgement and a special thank you for your sponsorship. It will contain work and information about the students graduating in 2015

A Bespoke Tote: an individually customised tote bag hand-made by a student. 
It will contain a copy of our Exhibition Catalogue containing acknowledgement and a special thank you for your support.

A Bespoke Bundle: a tie or bowtie, (donors choice) hand made by a student in a choice of colours; a bespoke tote, made and individually customised for you; a copy of the Exhibition Catalogue containing acknowledgement and a special thank you for your sponsorship

A BESPOKE SUIT!!
We will measure and fit you for a fully bespoke two-piece suit.
Due to logistics this will only be available for those who could come to London for measuring and fittings.
A choice of cloths will be available
risk:
The biggest risk we are facing is not reaching our target. We are relying on this event as a way to make an impact in a notoriously difficult industry. 
Without the funds to make it happen many talented people will never get the opportunity to show what they can do.

blurb1: We have been hard at work recording an album of original music, and we are nearly done - with just the production phase left.
title: King Leo Revival Album
reward_backer_tup: For a $15 pledge you receive an access code to download a high-quality digital version of the album, including a pdf lyric/liner notes booklet.

For a $25 pledge you receive an access code to download a high-quality digital version of the album, including a pdf lyric/liner notes booklet. You also receive a full-colour digitally-printed A3 poster of Manu Berry's Revival cover art.
Dust off that turntable and pledge $30 to receive Revival as a vinyl LP. This pledge also includes a digital download so you can listen on other devices.

It will be more fun to listen while wearing a 100% cotton t-shirt with Manu Berry's lovely album artwork. T-shirts come in dark blue or black, and you can specify size from S to 3X. This pledge level also includes a digital download of the album with pdf lyric/liner notes booklet.
Vinyl Combination: For this Pledge you receive the vinyl Revival album, the A3 Cover Art Poster, a T-shirt, and a digital download of the album with pdf lyric/liner notes booklet.

At this pledge level we are you will receive a limited edition print of Manu Berry's Revival woodcut. Each unique print will be 70cm X 100cm and is handmade on 100% cotton acid & chlorine free fine art paper. This level also includes a digital download of the Revival album with pdf lyric/liner notes booklet.

Let's have a party! For a $1000 pledge, King Leo will come to the venue of your choice in Otago, New Zealand and play a show. Shows outside of Otago are available with the addition of negotiated transportation costs. The 5-piece band will give it heaps with 2 1/2 hours of music, and we will bring all the gear we need to put on the show. This pledge level also includes a digital download of the Revival album with pdf lyric/liner notes booklet.
risk: The main challenge will involve organising vendors to provide the album and pledge rewards and sending them to project pledgers. We have secured vendors and have verified costs for all of these, and we have a system in place for keeping track of project participants and details.

Because recording is nearly complete, and we have multiple backups of all data, the primary risk would be unforeseen delays from manufacturers. However, backup vendors have been researched in case this occurs.
I have released two albums before without mishap, so I have some experience negotiating the challenges and risks involved.

blurb1: 3 acoustic artists, 3 EPs, 1 awesome CD!
title: Can I Be Happy? A Kickstarter by Josh, Joey, and Anna
reward_backer_tup: A signed physical copy and digital download of the album, a thank you in the liner notes, and a wristband to the invite-only release party!

A signed physical copy and digital download of the album, a thank you in the liner notes, a wristband to the invite-only release party, and a custom-made pint glass that says "Can I Be Happy?", matching the one on our album cover! You'll receive your glass at the release party and be able to have your first drink from it.
Custom Songs! The artist of your choice will write a song for you and you will receive it on a personalized CD. Plus you get everything listed above.

If the Kickstarter funds, all backers at the $5 level and above will be given a password-protected URL that they can point their web browser to for the current version.

We're still learning how to do this for iOS, but it's something we've seen done, and suspect it won't be too difficult.

The backer rewards have all been sourced with vendors we've used before, and Ad Astra Games has a good track record of shipping merchandise in the US and to Canada. risk: With any film production there is a certain amount of risk. It's a tough endeavor that requires experience, patience, communication and a healthy dose of luck. At the last minute you could lose a location, an actor could get hurt on set, equipment could break, your hard drives of footage could get stolen from your car. Any of these can set back a production. The fortunate thing is that our production company has years of experience working in an independent and low budget filming environment and we've always pulled through.

We're prepared to postpone shooting days, we're prepared to navigate any obstacles and finish this movie. Our cast and crew are flexible and just as dedicated to this film as we are. They know that things might have to be rearranged and we've allocated funds in the budget to make up for any reshoots and rescheduled shoot days.

The production itself is only scheduled for a 5 day shoot. Each day is scheduled and set up to allow for mishaps and changes and everyone working on the film knows how to work around these challenges. We aim to shoot in May, but if we can't finish it all in one go we're prepared to keep working at it all year long to finish filming.

risk: If the project creator gets hit by a bus, struck by a meteor or abducted by shadowy forces it will fall to a small staff of unpaid volunteers to pull off the event.
A large scale disaster or inclement weather could cancel the event. This is unlikely to happen in California in April, but still possible. Please refrain from testing your weather machine nearby.

If our host venue (Game Kastle) burns down, is taken over by squatters or shut down by overzealous bureaucrats, we will be forced to find a new location.  We have a back up location, but in the event that falls through, the event would have to be canceled.

We outlined how the on site raffle works above, and it should be in compliance with Kickstarter policy (as it is wholly separate from the Kickstarter campain).  However, if it turns out not to be in compliance, we reserve the right to cancel the raffle.

Our goal is to provide six meals (lunch and diner each day) on site.  However, if we are unable to get the required number of sponsors, we will need to scale back this plan.  You might hate the food, or hungry gamers might eat all of it before you get any.

risk: The life of a professional musician is full of risks, challenges, bizarre scenes. With the advent of the internet there are a million new ways to succeed at music, but the competition is greater. We believe in our material, and we believe in ourselves. We believe recording an album that will stand the test of time takes a lot: vision, discipline, talent, wonderful people who believe in you, strategy, integrity. Most of all it requires spirit in the form of lyrics, grooves, harmonies, love and camaraderie between band mates. It takes all that. We got it.

So what are the risks? In the long term- everything. As relates to the album- equipment problems, coordinating schedules, waking up on the wrong side of the bed. Is that going to stop us from making something wonderful? No. And it will be ready by June 2015.

risk: Time is obviously a huge factor in completing this project. I am still a full time student, and also pouring a lot of time into my community through church. Daniel is also busy working full time as a music producer. However, we both believe that our passions will come through in the end. Late night recording sessions are expected, along with consistent communication to stay on the same page. We trust in the support of our friends and family to understand our circumstances, in the case of a delay. The EP is expected to release late July 2015, but we expect no later than early fall this year. But be assured we are working as hard as we can. We thank everyone in advance for believing in us!

risk: Since our first project we have learnt a great deal about releasing products in Australia and abroad while working with our partnered factories abroad. The biggest issue we faced was getting our and ideas across to the production team without the process getting lost in translation. To rectify this we spent months looking for the right manufacturing partner that could not only meet our high demand for quality but could relate to us in a way that helped our ideas come to fruition. Another challenge dealing with an overseas manufacturing partner is that their working holidays are different to ours, meaning that orders could be delayed. To avoid this we have synced our working calendars to clearly be able to forecast ordering and production times. This has been an excellent advantage for both us, our manufacturing team and customers. They know when to expect orders and we know when to expect delivery.

risk: The main issue we face is the rental of an exhibition space, although we do have some galleries and institutions that we are discussing terms with. The space we eventually acquire may provide us with challenges regarding hanging the work and general display, but we have curated exhibitions together before and we are now confident in our abilities, especially as a group. risk: Not much has changed in two years. We still encounter the challenges of a bootstrapped start-up. Gigabot could still come to life with an insatiable appetite for all things resin. The bad news is -- he'd probably eat through every plastic bottle, lego, and video game controller in your home. Good news is, you'll have so much fun printing massive objects with Gigabot, you'll no longer care about that stuff. And you'll have more of Mike's awesome stools available on our Sketchfab account than you ever dreamed possible.

In a more likely scenario... prize deliveries could be delayed. To avoid potential of production delays due to unexpected part shortage or late supplier delivery, we are currently procuring inventories of all parts in advance of Kickstarter campaign. In addition, as a beta stage prototype, Gigabot's functionality and design will be continually improved and iterated over the course of the next several months. As such, we can't be sure about the printer's final performance metrics and specifications. Finally, the utility of Gigabot's printable output is inherently dependent on the structural properties of the plastic input filament material. Thus, it may not be suitable for all intended uses. re:3D is currently working on improving the versatility and structural integrity of input materials, so stay tuned for future product innovations.

We promise to provide you consistent, open dialogue, and an ever-ready dedication to innovation and technological improvements -- made possible through the cooperation and support of the Kickstarter community!
