risk: RISKS ARE LOW

Digital Amplifier Company has successfully designed and built amplifiers for more than 18 years. We need to overcome various technical issues to produce this STATE of the ART amplifiers .Taking advantage  of our already established engineering design methodologies; to bring another unique Amp  to the High-End Audio market. Our product development process is proven to be highly  effectively. This will be our  5th amplifier in the Cherry product line. We continually push the envelope in Amplifier design, while maintaining our focus on the customer. This has given us a growing and loyal customer base.
CHALLENGES
Our biggest design challenge with MINT Maraschino is putting two channels on one board and still achieving a SNR of more than 120dB.

This amp must remain true to it's Cherry heritage while pushing the limits of audio technology .

HOW WE WILL USE THE MONEY

The goal is to offer a versatile stereo amplifier with extremely high performance for well under $2000. This will require us to utilize our design expertise to lower the cost of materials without compromising performance.
The funds will also be used to get the MINT Maraschino into production. This requires finalization of PCB layout, component selection, and mechanical design.
SUPPLY CHAIN / TIME LINE

Another challenge is dealing with long lead time items. Some specialty components have 8-10 week delivery, so component selection and purchasing must be well in advance of prototyping and pre-production runs. We need to place orders immediately with our supply chain partners.
There is also much testing and tweaking to do in order to optimize sound quality while maintaining excellent measured performance.
We will also build the MINT Maraschinos in an assembly line fashion which will speed up the build and test process while reducing cost.

The first will be getting an illustrator to be able to convert my vision and the words on the page into drawings that are captivating and communicative.  In coming up with the concept that's included here, I worked with a wonderful illustrator and learned how many backs and forths are needed to even come up with a single drawing.
The second challenge will be actually getting the story put into book form.  I intend to work with one of the self-publishing tools that is user-friendly and affordable.

Finally, I expect it will be tough - once I have the book in hand - to develop an audience and demand for the story.  There, I plan on pounding a lot of pavement and school and library doors.  I'm a pretty well-connected mom in Arlington County, VA and expect that I'll have to lean on those connections to make this happen.  Also, social media will be an essential element of my marketing strategy, including my Facebook and Twitter accounts.

risk: When we got involved in the All Dock project, we always felt very uncomfortable because we were in a weak position to manage the risk. The project was sourcing from different companies that did not talk to each other, and it was questionable whether we were dealing with a trading company or actual manufacturer.  We parachuted into the project to get it delivered. There was no quality management system, nor was there an IT infrastructure to support fulfillment and customer service. What we experienced was typical of many Kickstarter projects, making them very risky.

We founded the Plashr platform because of our risky experience.  Our goal with Plashr is to mitigate the manufacturing risk and to build the infrastructure to better distribute our products and serve our customers globally.  We did it by partnering and offering a compelling value proposition to the right manufacturers.  With a manufacturer in the founding team, we are now vertically integrated with access to everything PCB (design, assembly and firmware programming), injection molding design/production and product assembly.  We are also putting in place a Quality Management System across the entire supply chain, including at our supplier factory.  In short, we are addressing the risk at the root of the problem.

Nevertheless, there will still be unforeseen circumstances going forward.  Some we can foresee early, but some may pop up during execution.  For example, we have been told there is a backlog in the supply of Apple-certified chipsets for lightning connectors.  We are still engineering our circuitboard to combine Qualcomm Quick Charge 2.0 and existing USB handshake protocols/standards. We will announce how we will support Quick Charge 2.0 at 9V, 12V and 20V.

On the fulfillment front, we are working with logistic companies to pin down the most efficient and cost effective way to ship in the USA, EU countries, Australia, Canada, Japan and Greater China with no shipping and import duty/tax.  Our goal is not to make money on shipping but to lower the cost of ownership of our product for everyone around the world.  Today, we know where we can send with no shipping charges, and many countries have no import duty/tax below a certain amount. For the rest of the countries (not listed above) we have to impose a $20 shipping surcharge.  As we uncover ways to ship to new countries, we will update you.  If you know of a cheaper and effective way to ship to your country, please let us know.

Finally, we would like to add that our challenges go beyond Kickstarter.  Kickstarter is a valuable launchpad to connect with our backers. We would be doing a disservice to our backers if we did not grow and bring more innovations to market.  The Plashr brand is also the platform for how we are going to get there.  We are developing the capability of selling online everywhere, including China.

risk: It’s hard for a web series to find an audience, and harder still because of how many amazing series' are out there. We want to make sure we get our series out to everyone, and that is a daunting challenge, making sure a series finds it’s viewers. So we’re planning on reaching out to as many different types of viewing platforms as we can, and relying on our understanding of grassroots marketing to get the word out. And, of course, keeping it completely free to view!

Finding locations for shooting in New York can be difficult, and our shooting requires a very specific kind of space, one that says “therapy” without screaming it. Scouting locations can be difficult, but we have three savvy New Yorkers on the job, and a long history of doing favors for other people, so we are confident that whatever happens, we’re going to make it work.

blurb1: Help fund big orchestra for gala concert and party for conductor's 10th anniversary season with Choral Art Society of the South Shore.
title: Choral Art Society of the South Shore--Celebration Concert!
risk:
We do not expect many challenges.  Of course, we hope all singers  and instrumentalists will be healthy and that many people come to our concert.  
Twice in our ten years together (the Choral Art Society and Danica, the conductor), we have had two instrumentalist either not show up for the concert or show up late.  We do not hire those two people anymore.  And one time, a flutist forgot her flute and music!  Miraculously, a singer had a flute in her car!  And Danica downloaded the flute orchestral part on the computer in the minister's office before the concert!  And the flutist played the part.  So we made it.  Phew.  But we hope for no more challenges of that nature.  The chorus will be prepared, the conductor will be ready, and the instrumentalists and soloists will show up to create exquisite music with us.

risk: So as you can see, we have made a start and begun shooting & editing some models to show you some examples of what to expect for 2016.

We have had 2 years of fantastic success creating RED HOT calenders, so we know first hand all the major pitfalls and challenges that come with their creation, and have ironed out most of the problems.

We have all the models lined up to shoot and have found some AMAZING new people. We also know how to design the calendar, what our market is, and which company to use to create them - we have all this sorted, and decided on the 'look' of both calendars to keep them fresh and competitive in their calendar markets.
Believe it or not, there currently isn't a calendar devoted to redhead girls - so we plan to fill this gap in the market.

Our main challenge will be finding the 3 last remaining GUYS for the boy calendar - (we have 9 hot guys lined up already) and luckily we have just had a BERLIN exhibition confirmed (4th April at Bikini Mall) in association with our RED HOT 100 book publisher Bruno Gmünder:

As for the girls, the main challenge - believe it or not, is the POSE - topless girls have 2 extra things on their chest the boys don't need to worry about. There is only so much strategic hair and hand placing we can do to disguise BOOBS - and unfortunately Facebook does not support the 'free the nip' campaign, so there will be no Boobs on show. 2016 RED HOT CALENDARS - PRESS RELEASE:

Thomas Knights’ explosive RED HOT project continues to expand around the world with exhibitions in Sydney, New York, Amsterdam, London and now Berlin. Making international catwalk stars of his ginger models and discovering the now world renowned RED HOT 100 cover-star Ken Bek working in a juicing shop, 2016 looks set to continue the ginger revolution. With a brand new look calendar for the boys  (now in its 3rd successful year),  and a whole new RED HOT girl calendar, 2016 will surely amplify the appeal of the brand to new, untapped audiences across the globe, and continue to challenge any negative stereotyping we might still posses toward the redhead.

As in previous years, sales of the 2016 RED HOT girl and boy calendars will support the Anti-Bullying Alliance. Models include RED HOT 100 cover star Ken Bek, Team GB canoeist Tom Brady, and international catwalk model Jake Hold. New to the girls calendar are a host of Playboy bunnies and top fashion models, circus artist Katrina Lilwall, and burlesque performer Sophia St Villier.

blurb1: Stryd is the world’s first wearable power meter. With your support, we’ll give runners the one number that can help them run better.
title: Stryd – The World’s First Wearable Power Meter for Running
reward_backer_tup: Stryd New Year’s Resolution (1 Stryd device)
Stryd Coaches Super Early Bird  (3 Stryd devices)
Stryd + Watch Bundle  (1 Stryd device, 1 Suunto Ambit 3 Sport)
risk:
This Kickstarter campaign aims to introduce power-based training to the running community. Even though it has long been the standard for training in cycling, power is new to the running world. There is no prior knowledge how to use power to guide day-by-day training and racing. Such knowledge needs to be created and then disseminated among the running community. We believe this is the biggest risk of bringing power, such a disruptive metric, to running.

This is also the reason why we launch this Kickstarter campaign. Over the past three years, we have been working with runners, coaches, and sports physiologists in the Boulder area. Kickstarter offers a great platform to reach the running community worldwide. Through this campaign, we would like to work with runners worldwide to collect and analyze running power data. We would like to support coaches and sports physiologists to investigate and develop power-based training programs. We would like to collaborate with third-party training platforms to disseminate power-based training knowledge to everyone who wants to run better, faster, and safer. 

Another potential common risk in the wearable space is hardware fabrication. Our team has been working with multiple reputable manufacturers in China since 2011. Our hardware engineers spend many months of their time each year in China, working with the ODM/OEM engineers on the same manufacture floor. We do not foresee further challenges on the hardware fabrication side.  We promise to do our best to deliver Stryd with high quality in the summer.

risk:
Please note that when you start printing bigger objects the risk of failure is also becoming bigger. That’s why I would like to share some tips and tricks with you.
1. I prefer printing with a large nozzle to keep the printing time within limits.
2. Bigger prints need more filament, so keep an eye on the end of the spool! I'm experimenting with a filament detection system from Tunell.
3. Use Octoprint for remote control and monitoring to keep an eye on your print.
4. Don't be afraid to resume stopped prints.
5. Use the included support system to stabilize your print.
6. Find and share your knowledge and thoughts on the Ultimaker forum!

The Z-Unlimited is a proven add-on. To take this into production shouldn't be risky. All production files and bill of materials are there and used for 10 setups already. To expand production to the first 30 early bird backers is very realistic. I might get a problem though when more than 1000 people back this project, but even then the production shouldn't be a problem.
The biggest challenge is to keep the shipping costs within a reasonable price...

risk: We believe that the information that Sick to Death! will convey is critically important to patient health.  It is imperative, therefore, that we get to DISTRIBUTION in a timely fashion: That way, patients can get the help they need as quickly as possible, and the public and medical community can fully comprehend the complications surrounding thyroid disease.

We are making every effort to continue editing to get to FILM COMPLETION and DISTRIBUTION, but if we only make our first stated Kickstarter goal of $10,000, it's possible that the the film may not be available when we hoped.

To mitigate these risks, we will continue to fundraise for the film and work diligently towards our final goal of $50,000.  We’ll also allow supporters to continue to give donations – EVEN PAST THE KICKSTARTER DEADLINE. Should the project make more than $50,000, I assure you, those funds can be utilized to further propel the film out into the world and create the change we know is possible!

blurb1: The bees need our help, and it's science to the rescue! Help me study which hive design best keeps bees warm and dry.
title: The Cozy Bee Project
reward_backer_tup: Inside scoop: you will be emailed a pre-release version of the final report. Know which hives perform the best before anyone else does!

Patron: A prerelease of the final report, plus a nifty Cozy Bee Project sticker and your name will appear in the credits of the final report and the slide presentation at the state beekeepers' conference.

Bee backer: The final report, the bee sticker, a tin of lip balm made from beeswax collected in my apiary,  plus you get to name one of the colonies in the study. Colony A, Colony B, Colony C… that's so boring. How about Fred's Foragers?

Bear Defender: This new bonus reward is to help accomplish the Stretch Goal of building the new Bear Exclosure. You get a pair of handmade beeswax candles from my apiary (I don't make very many of these, so quantity is limited), in addition to all of the rewards from the $50 level and below. Let's keep bears and bees separated!
Sweet reward: A half-pint of premium knotweed honey, made by the very bees I am studying! You will also receive the pre-release of the report, the bee sticker, and a tin of beeswax lip balm.

Stretch goal OVERDRIVE: you'll get all of the goodies from the $100 reward (honey, stickers, lip balm, etc) PLUS, you get to name the colony AND I'll paint one of the new hives in special commemorative paint scheme just for this special event. I'm thinking racing stripes? Send me your ideas!
Twice as nice: Everything under "sweet rewards", plus another half-pint of golden multifloral honey. That's two different flavors of honey... a honey sampler platter!

Official Sponsor: previous rewards, plus your name or company logo will appear all over the place- on the report, in the presentation, on a hive or two… it might even get stenciled on a few bees if I can figure out how to do it.
Bee Statesman: previous rewards, plus I'll paint one of my hives permanently in a scheme designed (with your input) to commemorate your heroic support for all eternity.
risk: Beekeeping, like most agricultural endeavors, can be unpredictable.  Some challenges:

Colony death: this can occur from pesticide overspray, bear attack, parasitic mite infestation, Colony Collapse Disorder, or a host of other ills. My best defense against this is to be proactive, using the best management practices I've learned in my years of keeping bees and studying in the Master Beekeeper program. Having multiple colonies in each test group will ensure that if I lose a colony or two, I will still get useful data for analysis from the other survivors.

Sensor failure: In the event of a technological disaster, I could lose all the data I've spent a year collecting. To prevent this, my entire project directory will be backed up weekly by an automated backup system, with archive files stored on a submersible fireproof drive. I will download sensor data quarterly.

Erroneous analysis of data or faulty collection methodology: In order to perform this study to the highest academic standards, I've enlisted the aid of Dr. Dewey M. Caron, professor emeritus at the University of Delaware and internationally recognized bee entomologist; as well as Dr. Ramesh Sigili, apicultural scientist and professor at Oregon State University. They will be reviewing my research and advising me during the project.

risk: As with all projects involving first time manufacture of a new product, the key risks for Sealz relate to the manufacturing process. Specifically, the ability of the manufacturer to deliver what they say they can, and within the timeframe they say they will.

We will be working with a manufacturer in China, but in order to mitigate the above risks we will also employ an experienced intermediary with local representatives to ensure we have proper on site communication and supervision of the production process.

Another common risk with this type of project relates to whether our manufacturer can successfully replicate our prototype using injection molding. However we have held comprehensive discussions with designers and manufacturers and are confident this will not be a problem with Sealz.
Check out our BIO page to see the full breadth of skills and experience within our team of advisors - which will also go a long way in mitigating the above risks.

risk: As far as rewards we won't have any issues getting them out on time.  With film, especially documentaries, we do anticipate plenty of exciting discoveries as we continue the interview process which might lead to some additional interviews and ideas.   We really want to have the film premiere at a hometown festival in January and aim to have it finished then but we just want to be sure we've done the story justice first.

Since almost all of the interviews are with musicians we're at the mercy of their touring and recording schedules.   We've had a great response from musicians that want to be a part of this but we know that it won't be possible to interview every musician that went on to huge acclaim.    The people we can't get will still have their stories told as best we can through narrative or we'll do our best to reschedule.
We really couldn't me more excited to tell this story and present it to the world.

Production team:
Michael Hurcomb
Ryan Lalonde

risk: In the three and a half years of production on this project, Amy Geller and Allie Humenuk have: wrapped all filming in America and in Italy; launched a successful friends and family fundraising campaign; applied for and received several grants; finished a rough cut of the film; and secured significant interest from broadcasters and film festivals.

Both filmmakers have experience directing and producing feature-length documentaries, and they are aware that there are potential risks involved in filmmaking. blurb1:
We're launching a bike-powered food waste pickup program!
The Beacon Compost Project is going to transform waste into community.
title: Beacon Compost Project
reward_backer_tup: Zero to Go reusable food storage container from Preserve Products, a Certified B Corporation just like us
Zero to Go reusable food storage container from Preserve Products + Zero to Go t-shirt
Reusable bento box from Takenaka + utensil kit
Large canvas Zero to Go tote bag from ECOBAGS, a local Certified B Corporation just like us + Zero to Go reusable food storage container from Preserve Products
Reusable picnic set from Preserve Products (pack for 20): includes plates, bowls, cups, and utensils in an insulated picnic bag
risk: (1) Pricing: We are pricing our service based on the projected volume, and cost of materials, staff, insurance, and ongoing maintenance. However, residents in Beacon are not accustomed to paying upfront for waste removal because it's built into our taxes. As waste disposal costs are rising across the country and food waste remains unaddressed, we think it's critical to build a composting program in response. Many Beaconites agree and are backyard composting already, but our service aims to address apartment dwellers and businesses. Our pricing, $40 for residences and $105 for businesses, raises questions of equity and access to this service. Through the help of the initial participants, who we consider early investors, we will be able to scale up and run an efficient and increasingly cost effective program that grows to be accessible citywide.

(2) Training + feedback: Identifying the correct feedback system for participants and our staff will take time. We want to continuously improve our trainings for our participants, especially in commercial kitchens, to make sure composting is easy and it's easy for us to catch any mistakes. Like everything else, this pilot is intended to test our approach and refine it.

(3) Routes: Only by actually running the routes will we be able to make the routes faster and more streamlined for our pick up staff. Additionally, we will be testing the locations for participants to leave their food waste outside for pick up to ensure that it is undisturbed, not collected with regular garbage and recycling, and easy to access by our staff.

risk:
How far along is the project, you ask?

We are ready to produce. Using the Gamecrafter makes this a slam dunk and really speeds the process up for you backers! If we do end up blowing up, we may revisit a traditional manufacturer which will take longer -- we shall see :-)

On April 8th, the project ends. 

IF stretch goals are met, that's totally awesome, but may delay production a month or so in order to create more cards or swagg.

We will deliver PDF print and play version and coloring books within one month of the project ending. 

I'm estimating 2 months to complete the production process with the company we are targeting to produce it once we begin. 

Unless we are overwhelmed with backers or have unforeseen issues we will likely be able to have these in the mail within a month of production. 

My very conservative estimate is you will have your hard copy(ies) of Zoo Webs in your possession in September with plenty of time before Christmas. I will keep all backers updated through Kickstarter should this change. I'd estimate it is more likely to be earlier than later, but this is the first card game / commercial hard good I've produced so I may be underestimating the production and shipping times.

risk: Risks are minimal as I am, as you know from past projects, a master craftsman. No late fulfillment, no excuses, no delays.
You get your reward when and how you picked it on or before the date indicated at your pledge level.

Delivery of materials may delay progress if I cannot get the correct dice in the correct quantities. I have chosen the most popular colors however and all major dice manufacturers have these colors as open stock, so it shouldn't be an issue.

I plan to run this campaign back to back with my Dice Base Zero campaign, which I'm finishing up now here on Kickstarter. The DBZ campaign will be fulfilled by the end of march, before this campaign ends.
Additionally I plan to run another dice campaign here on Kickstarter: The DICE of DEATH and DISMEMBERMENT, which will start towards the beginning or middle of April.

All these projects are designed to be staggered so that fulfillment for one is over before its time to work on the fulfillment of another, and in the case of the D.O.D.A.D. campaign fulfillment will be 6-10 weeks from the end of the campaign, so there's no chance of overlap there.

Still, things happen that are unexpected and unforeseen delays may occur. I have and will do everything in my power to prevent these things from affecting your rewards. So far so good. 100% on time and on-schedule.

blurb1: Smalls to the Wall is a grass roots whitewater kayaking event. I launched it last year and need help to document it and keep it alive!
title: Smalls to the Wall ! A whitewater kayaking steep creek event
reward_backer_tup: My sincere heartfelt appreciation. Thank you so much! Go you!

risk:
The most obvious challenge I face in completing this project is in predicting when the best window to hold the event will be. While some other kayaking events are scheduled around dam release rivers, this event requires snowmelt to raise the rivers to the appropriate level, and it also requires warm enough temperatures for any ice bridges that may have formed over the canyon to clear.  Its not an exact science, but I'm confident that I can predict when the gorge will melt and open up based upon my own personal experience with the place and input from fellow 
paddlers. The worst case scenario would reschedule the race by a week or two, due to hazardous conditions. Other minor concerns include last minute adjustments in order sizes for t-shirts, or a delay in making copies of the race footage, but I feel confident that all rewards will be delivered by the estimated delivery date.

Welcome to 2303AD! You want to be a part of the evolving story, and we want to make that happen! You will get to write a few sentences about how you envision yourself in the setting (Breaker? Prod? Hero, Traitorous Villain, or something else entirely?) risk: Most of the development is done at this point. Master casts of most of the miniatures from this Kickstarter are already in hand. The slowest part of the process will be completing the box art, but after the box art is complete it will only take a matter of weeks to get the boxes printed and converted. Each part of the process I now have experience in and I've padded the delivery date to account for delays.
This Kickstarter has been designed to build backer faith by showing what we can do. That is its mission.

blurb1: Can a pattern in multiplication and series create and break a one way function? Namely RSA
title: One Way Functions?
reward_backer_tup: Every backer will get a least a 5 page article.
risk: Assumptions and Risks

1.The risk of Project 1 or N vs. P is Mr. Snyder’s mathematical problem solving reputation. It is not that he had a reputation. Instead when you work so hard on a problem that is assumed impossible and produce little no one is going to read your work. However, Mr. Snyder explains that it is a learning process and not just a ploy to produce garbage math. In creating this problem Mr. Snyder has had to research geometry, trigonometry, and number theory. This while reading as much as he could about cryptography. This problem is serious. It is not a joke. It is finding a pattern in multiplication using only elementary math.

2.The risk of finding information on Mr. Field. Is reaching a dead-end. By this I mean that no one other than Mr. Snyder sees the significance to research. But if Mr. Snyder could find more information he could convince others of the interest in this story.

risk: DET kan DU göra för oss:
Franska Filmfestivalens team jobbar hårt för att genomföra den 16:e upplagan! Men vi behöver er hjälp och stöd så att filmerna kan nå den svenska publiken och vi kan bjuda hit nya spännande gäster.

En summa på 20.000 Sek skulle hjälpa oss att betala rättigheterna för två helt exklusiva filmer med frakt till och från Sverige (ungefär 15.000 Sek) samt resan för en fransk skådespelare eller regissör (ungefär 5.000 Sek) som kan presentera filmerna under Franska Filmfestivalen och träffa svenska publiken!
Om vi är många som hjälper till kan detta bli möjligt!
[ENGLISH VERSION]
What YOU can do for us:
Franska FilmFestivalen is working hard to make this 16th edition happen but we need support to bring films to our audience and invite guests.

20.000SEK would allow us to pay for the rental of two films, their transportation to and from Sweden (15.000SEK approx.) and the trip of a French actor/ress or director to present their film during FFF (5.000SEK approx.). That way, they’ll be able to meet with the Swedish audience and share their opinions about French cinema.
It’s high time you come and join us on that adventure!

risk: Life happens, a lot, and sometimes things don't go as planned. The biggest risk is not getting funded, because it's all or nothing with this campaign. If I don't reach the goal, the album doesn't get a cent to move forward.

Thankfully, I'm tenacious and devoted, and I really believe in this project. I'm also lucky to think a lot of people in my life will believe in it too. In the event of any setbacks or delays, I'll be sure to keep everyone informed and do all I can to stay the course.

risk: Well, we do live on an island in the middle of the ocean and if it just so  happens that a hurricane hits us and wipes out the island, that may complicate things.

However, we have a fantastic manufacturer that we are excited to be working with and we are very confident in their work, therefore we do not see any complications with the manufacturing process. A down side of living on this amazing island is that at times things can take longer than anticipated due to the limited control we have with shipping companies. In our opinion our biggest potential obstacle we foresee is being able to ship our products to you on time, but it is our goal to make sure this doesn't become a problem.

risk: Well, this performance is going to happen. We have a great team committed to the work that we’re doing with IBOC. The risks are minimal. And, since we’ve produced before, we have the experience of putting on a good show already under our belt. But there remain significant challenges to producing live music in a city like New York City. We are dependent upon the support of our patrons and audience members to continue to provide high-quality performances.
Thank you for your continued support of IBOC. We are grateful for your support and we hope to see you on March 26th:

The American-Scandinavian Foundation @ Scandinavia House
58 Park Avenue @ 38th Street
New York, NY 10016

Thursday, March 26
8pm Concert
Pre concert talk: 7:30pm. Wine Reception after concert. Celebrate!
$20 ($15 ASF Members)
For reservations: call 212.847.9740 or email event_reservation@amscan.org.
We believe that opera is the art-form of the future!

risk: There are no obstacles that can get in the way of finishing Consuming Coral Reefs if we can raise the needed money to finish layout, graphic design and print production work. The book is written. It's been edited by experts, and all images have been bought and paid for.

After the book is done, however, there are many challenges ahead. Fundraising: to pay for travel to conferences, to print and ship books, and to continually update Fintegrity's website, products and services all require a great deal of time and effort. But they're things we've successfully done before, things that come with the territory when you run a small non-profit.

A walk on-role will be written for you in our next production.

Ian will shave his head live on Skype.
risk: The fundamental challenge that LIGHTNING BUGS IN A JAR faces in succeeding as a Kickstarter campaign is comparable to the challenges that the film faces in a greater context. How do we foster support for the future of the film among friends and family, let alone those who do not know us personally, when the market is saturated with comparable forms of content, across countless platforms? One immediate challenge that we face is garnering enough attention to get industry professionals into theaters and viewing rooms at the Cannes Short Corner, where our competition among other projects is formidable. As a small ‘fish’ in a very large ‘pond’ of exceptional short films from around the globe, LIGHTNING BUGS… ultimately has to be seen and experienced in order for it to connect with people. While we are confident in our work as artists and are tremendously proud of the film, we acknowledge that the market for short films today is increasingly competitive, perhaps more so than ever before. As attention spans continue to shorten, the tradition of going to a theater to see a movie has become both endangered and sacred. The array of ways in which people consume entertainment seems limitless and geared more toward portability and viewer convenience than supporting the standard movie-going experience.

In order to reach our goal, we must convince you that we are worth your investment. Here, it is the nature of our own collective passions that we hope to transfer to you. It is written all over this page, imbued in each image from pre-production to the making of the film itself. Our passion (as well as our preparation and persistence) for LIGHTNING BUGS IN A JAR has spanned nearly five years. Being able to make the film we sought to make from the onset—without a single compromise—was a rare privilege that many renowned filmmakers do not even enjoy.

We simply ask for your investment, whatever the number may be, so that we are able to complete the process of seeing LIGHTNING BUGS IN A JAR through from an idea…to something on a page…to a film that, potentially, has the power to reach a global audience.

risk: We've done everything we can to minimise the risks and challenges, but every project faces them.

Changing our magazine production schedule from a quarterly to monthly is our biggest challenge. But we've been planning for it for three months now, and we are already starting to commission content as far ahead as our July issue. Our key team members have many years experience of working on monthly publishing cycles, so we're confident we will continue to deliver.

We also have a slight concern that we sell out of the limited edition singles. We don't think that's likely, but if it does happen, we are going to be inputting names by hand into our database, and then sending out a *lot* of records. It will mean some late nights, but we're committed to fulfilling our end of the bargain as efficiently as we can. And we will be as happy as Larry, because it will mean we have smashed our target by quite a margin!
We've got lots of hard work and lots of late nights ahead of us, but we do have coffee.*
*We might not have any tea left after you lot have drunk it all.

risk: Once our Kickstarter is successfully funded, our work will have only just begun.  But we are ready to roll.

There is always a chance that bug fixes will cause us to delay our release. Per Konstant InfoSolutions' suggestion we are going to be working them out in several builds as we work towards a usable version.This has maximized their efficiency in identifying user interface and overall functionality in past mobile app projects.

Apple is very strict when it comes to auditing apps, especially those which require native features of your iPhone. To counter this, we are relying on our developer’s experience in over 3,500 projects. Konstant screened our final wireframe for the same requirements as the app stores, allowing us to stay ahead of the game.
Great design and awesome ideas can only take you so far; we need early adopters like you to use our product in different environments and give us notes on what works and what does not.
We want to see how people with different wants and needs will create and attend events.
It is also to our advantage that we walked for commencement barely a year ago ourselves. We have a lot in common with the demographic we are trying to impress, so there is no disconnect.

Any successful product or service must be geared towards a small demographic. We will tailor our service for that specific group, and later expand its use to everyone.College students tend to be more outgoing, spontaneous and more exposed to different and new activities, which is why we selected them to be our target audience for Linute.

Starting at CUNY Baruch College, we will launch our app to several clubs and fraternities curating content and publish on-going activities nearby. Due to our initial presentations to these groups and by leveraging our team connections (attending leadership students), we are geared up, ready for these campaigns’ fast lanes.
In other words, our most valuable asset is the fact that we understand what our users want because we are part of the demographic.
We are excited to overcome these obstacles, 24 hours at a time.

risk: This is the first time in its 25 year history that The Soap Factory has produced a multi-disciplinary artistic project of this scale and ambition. WISE BLOOD, this original operatic composition and sculptural installation has the potential to bring together new audiences for creative endeavor across artistic disciplines - contemporary artists, sculptors, opera singers, brass musicians, rock 'n' rollers, writers and lovers of gothic Americana, into our uniquely preserved 130-year-old brick factory space in the heart of the city. The level and depth of this artistic collaboration is inherently new and risky. Bringing together our diverse artistic communities and organizations, we know that this is a risk worth taking, to test traditional artistic boundaries, and to engage, thrill and inspire new audiences in an unique immersive experience.

risk: How Does Kickstarter Work?

Kickstarter is an online fundraising platform that allows creators like us to make great projects through direct support from everyday people like you. However, Kickstarter is all or nothing. If we don’t hit the fundraising goal by our deadline, your credit card will not be charged, and we will not get any money at all. Please don’t let that happen. Join us in helping to produce more diverse content by contributing before it’s too late. In exchange for your pledge, you’ll receive gifts to shows our appreciation.
Here’s how you can help us:
-Hit the “Back This Project” button.
-Enter your pledge amount and select your reward.
-Confirm payment
-Tell your friends about our Kickstarter campaign!(optional but highly encouraged)

blurb1: We're making a documentary short that asks: 100 years after the genocide, how are the Armenian people not just surviving but thriving?
title: 100 Faces of Survival: A Documentary on Armenian Identity
risk: Every project comes with its share of risks and challenges. We'll be flying halfway around the world to interview people, largely in a foreign language. And we'll be trying to capture as wide a net as possible with a bare bones crew.

But we also bring a lot of built-in advantages. Jared has a track record of delivering high quality films, and getting them seen at festivals as well as on the web. Jared directed a web series called Winners that was successfully funded via Kickstarter last year, and currently has amassed over 85,000 views.

Lilit speaks Armenian, and brings many connections, both personal and professional, in Armenia and Los Angeles. This has given us a big leg-up in lining up interviews for this project. We have already received a lot of help from the Armenian community in getting this project off the ground, and we are continually touched by the outpouring of support.

risk: We are confident that both parts of our project --the musical MAX UNDERSTOOD, and the invented instrument installation Sound Maze for Max -- will be successful. risk: As seasoned filmmakers and movie producers, we have collectively created dozens of successful films, so there’s little risk involved once we procure the funds to finish this film. We have great relationships with the heads of major distribution companies, the technical know-how, understand the ins-and-outs of the film industry and most importantly, are driven by a purposeful passion to bring this life-affirming story to the masses. Any other challenges we face are par for the course, like coordinating shoot schedules and locations with our very busy cast and crew, for example.

The risk lies in NOT creating this film. We believe (and have scientific backup to support this belief) that a shift in awareness about our environment and health is absolutely critical. The time is now. If we wait for big business and government to take initiative, it will be too late. We must come together as conscious citizens and support the initiatives that will make positive, lasting change for our planet for generations to come. The research on mycelium is astounding, and we must make it common knowledge and give more power back to the people to make better decisions.

risk: I've done three kickstarters before, all three on time. With this game, just like those, the game design, graphics, rules, and packaging design are already pretty much set at the time of the campaign, which really minimizes our risks.
New types of components are one kind of risk. In this case, main new component is a 2" metal coin. The samples look fantastic, as you can see in the updates so .

On all my previous kickstarters, the biggest problem has actually been freight shipping delays. There are many factors there, all outside my control. The best I could do was guess at how long it would take if things didn't go my way. In all three cases, it ended up being a near worst-case scenario with shipping, but I STILL shipped on time because the original estimate was planning for the worst. To put it another way, the biggest risk here has to do with things being like a month late, as opposed to the game not functioning or being manufactured poorly, etc.

Also regarding shipping, this is the first time I'll be doing customs-friendly shipping. The team at Ship Naked has handled all my shipping for years and has done extremely well at it, so I'm pretty confident they can handle this well, reducing or eliminating VAT for most customers (but we can't actually promise anything here, just that it should be an overall improvement for most backers). Ship Naked has already coordinated this type of shipping for dozens of other kickstarters.

risk: There's no telling where that jungle path will lead, but even if there's naught but an overgrown hut and a few ghastly traces of X's last meal, I am confident that I will return from Suriname with more than enough material to complete this work.

As a work of speculative non-fiction, this film is necessarily subject to the whims of circumstance.  While I've hedged my bets that X will be available and willing to cooperate (my sources have already indicated as much), the framework that I've constructed, in which myth is as vital as fact, allows for his total absence - the rest will unravel in due time.

blurb1: Tell tales of dark and horrific fantasy with your friends using Robert J. Schwalb’s thrilling new tabletop roleplaying game.

risk: I waited to launch this Kickstarter until the game was written for a reason. I am cautious. I didn’t want tragedy, writer’s block, being hit by an asteroid impact, madness, or corruption to interfere with the design. Since I'm here and giving you a chance to pre-order this sexy game, this means the game is written, tested, and ready to go into the final stages of production. These stages include editing, layout, art acquisition, printing, and shipping the printed products into distribution. Though I am using the very best people in the business and I am confident we'll sail through these stages laughing all the way, things happen. To mitigate the risks, I have backup people in place just in case an editor gets sucked into a black hole or an artist decides to change careers mid-way through the project.

The biggest challenge is fulfillment. The difficulty fulfilling the Kickstarter rewards increases with its size. I will handle shipping the rulebooks to backers with the help of my dear friends and family. Digital products will be available as soon as they’re done. And if we unlock additional print products via stretch goals, they’ll be out as soon as we get them done.

Before launching this Kickstarter campaign, I received a physical and discovered that I am in fine health and in no danger of succumbing to natural causes between now and the end of the year. Of course, the hobo might get me, in which case, well, my clones will have to take over.

risk: As an award winning independent filmmaker of 25 years I have a deep understanding of the challenges that film production presents.  From actors not showing up to cameras starting to smoke and spark on set, you must be prepared for the worst.  We always design redundancy into our work.  Everything has a back up.  I work with the most talented and professional film crews on this planet.  Good will and cooperation are the currency of a thriving arts community.  We all work together, eat together and throw drinks on each other.  And in film production problem solving is a tool everybody has in their box.

Assuming we exceed the goal beyond our wildest dreams, and there should be any unforeseen challenges/issues that result in the delay of pledge rewards being sent out, not to worry. In life these things do happen, and if so, I will actively continue updating all pledgers on the entire production process following the end of the campaign, so that if for any reason the process takes longer than anticipated causing a delay in sending out pledge rewards before August 2015, then I will let you know immediately, and I promise to communicate with you the soonest date your pledge rewards will be able to be sent out. When you pledge to this campaign, you become a part of my musical family and I take that very seriously, holding it in the highest regard. Just as family takes care of each other, I promise I will take care of you by holding up my end of the bargain.

blurb1: The Inn at Duck Creek WILL be opening May of 2015..Wouldn't you just love to be a part of history in the making? Good! WE need YOU!
title: The Inn At Duck Creek - THE Gathering Place In Smyrna!
reward_backer_tup: I can't do much, but I really want to help!
No Reward Needed - Just because you want us to succeed!
Enjoy Two Chef Specialty Desserts and Coffee- Personally created and served by our chef.
Custom Designed Official Inn At Duck Creek T-shirt. These will only be available for our special backers.
A personalized bronze name plate mounted in the bar!
Personalized Beer Mug and One Year in the Inn at Duck Creek Mug Club!
One VIP ticket to our Opening Gala - An evening of fine food, beverages, and entertainment. The Gala will be supporting The Smyrna Opera House and Museum
5-Course Chef's Tasting Menu for 2, complete with pairings and as a special gift to you, 2 "Inn at Duck Creek" wine glasses.
2 tickets at the VIP Table at our Grand Opening Charity Gala

Four tickets for a hands on cooking class with our Chef! Workshop will include recipes, laughter, and of course you'll get to eat your homework! We'll even throw in 4 of our personalized Inn at Duck Creek Aprons
Dinner for 4 at the Chef's Table - a special meal created just for you! And as a special gift to you, 4 "Inn at Duck Creek" wine glasses.
Private reception for 20 people - includes appetizers and beverages
The Inn At Duck will name one of the 5 dining rooms in your honor. This is our most prestigious reward as you will be a permanent part of our project!
risk: So, how do we plan to pull off this project? Duck Creek Hospitality Group LLC has a strong background with over 20 years in the Food and Beverage Industry, combined with financial expertise, marketing and promotion and all the components necessary to make this project successful. While we are investing our own capital to fund most start-up activities, we want to secure additional funds to make the project very special - to be able to decorate the tavern and restaurant with historic items like antique signage, chandeliers, sconces, paintings, and to support the pre-marketing activities to make sure everyone from our neighbors in Smyrna, and from Wilmington to Ocean City to Washington DC are salivating for a taste of Inn at Duck Creek food and atmosphere, to gather with friends, and who are curious to sample our local beer wine and spirits in what will be a destination landmark restaurant.

We did a Kickstarter before and we weren't funded, so why do it again? Well there were a couple of reasons that we believe we weren't successful. One, the video was "lacking"..how's that for "it was pretty lame"? We've gone the professional route for this round, and if we may say so, it's just awesome - Kudos to Curious Iris for taking this to a whole new level.

Also, at the time of our first launch, we had just started our Facebook page and only had about 100 followers. Now, we're at almost 600 and it's growing every day. Add to that, people take us much more seriously now that they see the restoration process in full swing instead of just old vacant buildings dying on the corners of town.

Freedom is a gift. We would prefer to have accountability owed to those who inspire, support and share our vision, rather than allow an unforgiving outside influence into our creative and decision-making process. Getting a private investor is against everything we stand for—we don’t want to compromise the food we serve, the creative things that we want to do, or to overextend our chef or pay our staff less money. We believe in frugality and efficiency—we just don’t want to sell out to achieve it.

Everyone who backs this project will receive updates on the progress of our building and as we get closer to opening, making you the first to know all the latest news about our highly-anticipated Grand Opening.
Please help us open this restaurant and keep our vision intact. Please consider supporting this project. Please spread the word. And thank you for all you have done so far in supporting our efforts!

A special screening that we work out together!  If you're in the Chicagoland area, I can attend.  If you're far away, I can Skype in (with a cat?).   Could be this short plus other work--  We can work it out.

risk: I'm going to make this film no matter what!
In my mind, my biggest challenges are in raising the quality and legibility of my work so it can reach a wider audience.

Short films need love. Films should be the length they are meant to be.  This film is meant to be the length it is.  It's not a calling card for a longer movie.  I want it to be it's own entity.  And when it's finished I want people to see it, share it and value it's brevity and focus.

risk: The risks for this campaign are pretty minimal. Unlike many other Kickstarter projects where you may end up waiting quite a while to get your rewards. The designs for the shirts are already complete. I have been designing and printing shirts for a number of years now, and already have accounts setup with reliable manufacturers and distributors. As soon as the campaign is funded and I know which items have been requested, I will order all of the necessary articles right away, which will arrive in less than a week. I will only be using suppliers that I have already been using for years now, and I already know exactly what specific styles and manufacturers of the selected apparel items that I will be using, all of which is based directly on items that I have already used and worn myself leading up now, and have had nothing but great personal experiences with.

The biggest challenge after the undecorated items arrive in my possession, will be the fact that I'll be printing them all myself, and this will include extra amounts of overall labor, prep work and cleanup, because of the number of different designs and the fact that everyone will be able to customize the various styles with different colors and print locations. This is more of a workload challenge than a risk, because I already have all the necessary supplies and abilities to do the printing with, along with direct access to a local studio where I will be doing all of the printing at. All rewards will be shipped out by me within two months of the campaign ending, unless the demand from the campaign is higher than I can physically meet on my own, at which point I will also potentially employ the services of a high-quality, reputable local screen-printing studio to help out with the overall print-load. Any potential delays will be posted in the updates section right away, should they arise.

risk: Hiroshi says: Making a full length feature film is a challenge, for me and for anyone, even for a major studio. It is a substantial endeavor, with many moving parts. I have done my best to minimize risk and maximize use of funds without the slightest compromise to quality, and I have done this in several ways:

1. The lion's share of the film takes place in the cave/bunker, and so there are a limited number of sets. This adds efficiency to the production, and also creates an eerie environment to serve as a justifiable basis for the terrifying experiences of the characters.

2. The characters who enter the cave/bunker get sealed in, and although there are a few additional characters (and specters representing their personal nightmares,) there is a limited number of overall characters in this film, which also adds efficiency to the production, and makes the viewer more likely to identify with one in particular. Watch out who you pick.

3. The special makeup and other practical effects used in this film, will be largely engineered and executed from my friends and associates of my many years in this business. This also adds efficiency to the production, while delivering the most masterful effects from the most top-level talent imaginable.
4. I have substantial experience and great understanding of the film making process and have detailed a realistic schedule of scope of work, time frames, and budgets.
In summary, if the Kickstarter campaign succeeds, the film Gehenna - Where Death Lives, will be made and all rewards will be delivered fully and on a timely basis.
Thank you. - HK

risk:
Why you should trust Flesk Publications? John answers:
"I pride myself on having a thirteen year record of delivering over sixty books of the highest quality. We have run four previous Kickstarter campaigns, one with Brom and Mark Schultz, both of which were delivered on time. Our third campaign was with Frank Cho and a fourth with Petar Meseldzija for his Book of Giants (at the printer now). We were two weeks late shipping the Cho books due to the books being stuck on the docks due to a California port crisis. Things don't always go exactly as planned in the publishing world. Much of the time they do, but sometimes an unexpected problem or delay arises. In the rare case that this happens, simply put, I deal with it and find a way to get the job done. I am very open about any challenges and like to share in the process so people know what's going on. I don't like surprises, and don't feel anyone else should either. I respect the artist, and our supporters too much to let them down. The good thing is that I've published over sixty books and I know how to get them shipped and delivered, and I know how to manage a schedule and keep projects on track, and I will stay motivated and energized to get the books into your hands when I said I would. Bottom line, I would not have been around this long without an excellent track record."

blurb1: An epic road trip with a consummate outsider exploring all the wonderful, horrible, strange and surreal things America has to offer.

reward_backer_tup:

Good karma + exclusive backer updates from the production.

• 3 MONTH FANDOR MEMBERSHIP •
($30 value) 
Fandor is the best place online to watch quality movies. They have highly curated collection of rare gems and classics that you won't find on the mainstream sites. And soon on Fandor, you'll be able to find our first feature film, as well as Sea to Shining Sea (when it's completed!)

A postcard from one of the stops on the trip, with a personal note written by Boerleidier & Monihan.

3 original high resolution images from the road trip, full bleed photographs capturing the most striking and the most absurd from our journey.  These stills most definitely will not be your typical stock photos of Americana.

The official film festival movie poster for "La Voz De Los Silenciados (Voice of the Voiceless)" – our award winning debut feature film that has been described as "Chaplin meets Eraserhead". Check out LVDLS.com to learn more about the film. These posters are beautifully printed and always seem to get stolen whenever they're posted at film festivals.

Get an exclusive digital playlist of the music Boerleider & Monihan listen to on their trip, with  liner notes on why they chose the songs, along with original music from Newkirk scored for the film.

A pre-release, beautifully packaged DVD of "La Voz De Los Silenciados (Voice of the Voiceless)" – our award winning debut feature film that has been described as "Chaplin meets Eraserhead". Check out LVDLS.com to learn more about the film.

A pre-release, beautifully packaged BluRay of "La Voz De Los Silenciados (Voice of the Voiceless)" – our award winning debut feature film that has been described as "Chaplin meets Eraserhead". Check out LVDLS.com to learn more about the film.

• STILLS & TUNES FROM THE ROAD •
3 original high resolution images from the road trip, along with an exclusive digital playlist of the music Boerleider & Monihan listen to on their trip, with liner notes on why they chose the songs, and original music from Newkirk scored for the film.

• ROAD TRIP GRAB BAG •
Digital stills from the road, digital playlist from the trip, 3 month Fandor Membership PLUS your name in the Thank You credits of the film.

• LTD EDITION HAUNTED HOUSE PRINT •
($400 value) 
Original high quality photo print (11x14) of the Haunted House in Pennsylvania where Boerleider & Monihan will spend a night. Print by artist & photographer Sandra Dillon.

• LTD EDITION MONUMENT VALLEY PRINT
($400 value) 
Original high quality photo print (11x14) of Monument Valley (one of Boerleider and Monihan's stops) by artist & photographer Sandra Dillon.

• SKATE SESSION w/ BOERLEIDER & MONIHAN •
A 2-hour skate session with the OG skaters, available at 2 of the road trip destinations: Denver, Colorado and New York City. Parents, this would be a great gift for your kids that skate. Or maybe you're an old-timer that wants some pointers. Whatever the case, it will be a killer session. Ex-pro Monihan will show you the secrets on properly stalling inverts and Boerleider will critique your style with honesty and humor.

• SKYPE WITH BOERLEDIER & MONIHAN FROM THE ROAD •
A conference call like no other. Get a chance to talk with the traveling rapscallions themselves, live from the road!

• VISIT US ON A SHOOT DAY  •
Meet us at any one of the confirmed stops on our road trip, watch us shoot, and hang out. Maybe we'll grab a bite to eat or something too.

• PERSONAL BIKE TOUR OF AMSTERDAM BY BOERLEIDER •
If you are in Amsterdam anytime in the next year, Boerleider will give you a thoroughly entertaining, incredibly informative, private bicycle tour through the most famous bike riding city in Europe. This reward does not cover transportation or lodging...or your bicycle (but you can rent those in A'dam, easily). Valid for a year from April 2015 to April 2016.

• BE CAST IN THE FILM • 
Meet us at any one of the confirmed stops on our road trip and be in a scene of the film. We can't promise you'll win an Oscar, but who knows, it may be your big break?!

• ASSOCIATE PRODUCER CREDIT •
You will be named in the film credits as Associate Producer

• EXECUTIVE PRODUCER CREDIT • 
You will be named in the film credits as Executive Producer
risk: When you embark on any creative venture, you must acknowledge the endless number of things that can and most likely will go wrong. There's always a chance that everything can go up in smoke, or go on a trip to Hades, or find itself up a feces creek without a... whatever proverbial warning you like, it can all happen. But the beauty of this project is that disaster can enhance. We're telling a story here and conflict is the juice that fuels great tales. So rest assured, we're going to make something out of whatever gets in our way, or whatever we can get our hands on. After all, the name of our film company is Bricolagista! And making shine-ola out of s#!t, that's what Bricolage means.

risk: Having previously run a successful campaign, we know what we are in for, so we have planned accordingly. Last time we accomplished all set goals, with shipping made within the estimated time frame. The production of artwork is pretty much finished & finalised. Book & cover design will only take a couple of days. Printing we estimate will take a few weeks then shipping a week or two after that - depending on where you are in the world.

risk: The film will be shot locally by film students at the University of Alabama. The state of Alabama is currently in the midst of crucial battle for LGBTQ equality, as same-sex marriage licenses have been allowed and banned again within a month. Living in Alabama for the past 4 years has shown me the injustice and discrimination the LGBTQ community is treated with here. While making a film about a gay man in a world where he is rejected, we will likely encounter this hardship that so many people deal with every day. We will be making a "behind the scenes" documentary that follows the production of this film and its relationship to the current situation in Alabama. This doc will be made available immediately to anyone who contributes to Pride Fighter.

risk: The main risks we face are diseases and pests. Bees are living things and are not indestructible. Many natural events may cause the failure of a hive. We will do our best to use current accepted practices for dealing with different problems. It is possible to lose half the hives in a year! This is the nature of the business and it is not 100% avoidable. In the event that your adopted hive dies we will try to provide you with honey from a hive that has not died.

risk: Okay, let’s get real. Yep, we’re booting this development from scratch. There’s a lot that can go wrong between funding and delivery of the game we’re promising. We could run dry on funds, lose key people, mistake our original goals, and/or just not deliver the level of quality we imagined.
From Scratch?

Well, okay, not quite from scratch. We’re starting with Unreal Engine 4 as our off-the-shelf platform, a team experienced with integrating multiple front-end and back-end subsystems, and a creative group with the vision to deliver top-flight game design and artwork.
Funds

Our challenge, here, is to assure we properly scope both the project and ongoing revenues, and manage it well throughout the development. Eric Peterson is a multi-successful producer with a penchant for negotiating great deals and motivating his team through inspiration and example. Our project manager, Phil Tittle, is focused on preventing runaway costs and assuring we hit milestones. Our CTO, Jason Spangler, will guide us in making good technological decisions, allowing us to stay focused on getting the game done in an efficient manner.
Personnel Churn

Descendent Studios is a small team of very key people. Fortunately, we’re incredibly dedicated to reviving the Descent 6DoF genre and are really excited to see this through. That, along with a tightly scheduled development cycle to deliver our alpha and gold master releases, should decrease our risk of losing a vital person.
Proper Scope

Our biggest challenge is not overestimating what we can do with the funds, time, and team we’ve planned for the game’s development. Fortunately, our key people have all been responsible for delivering several successful game projects including Starlancer, Gods and Heros: Rome Rising, Ultima Online: Third Dawn, and Conquest: Frontier Wars. We’ll be applying all our experience and craft to delivering Descent: Underground on time and within budget.
Quality Experience
We really want to play this game. We really do. Anything less than what we promise is unacceptable.
Community Participation

In the end, we depend on our backers and tight-knit community to watch and respond as we dive into one more game project. It is your ongoing critical feedback that will keep us on our toes and sprinting to delivery.
(The Kickstarer video and graphic elements are a gameplay visualization created in Unreal Engine 4 with WIP assets.)

risk: Making a documentary film is always a challenge and not just for the obvious financial risks. The very nature of non-fiction filmmaking is not knowing what will happen. We know the film will resonate with a lot of people, but the challenge is getting the film to that audience.

The shooting of MONOGAMISH is finished and the edit is almost complete.  However, several elements are still needed to get the film out into the world.  We need to produce a trailer, DVDs, key art, a website, promos and viral videos. We have to create deliverable files and subtitles to make the film available on platforms like iTunes, Hulu and Amazon.  These companies want films in certain formats and unfortunately these formats aren’t cheap to create.  Beyond that, we are crafting a robust marketing campaign to get the message out to the mainstream.
Thanks for checking out our Kickstarter page.  A huge thank you for helping us get this film out into the world!

risk: The main challenge will just be completing the new comic in the very brief time remaining before MoCCA Fest. Shipping all the rewards, too, that's always a challenge. You may note that physical rewards only ship within the US — this is to minimize the risk of such shipping-related issues. Also, these mini-comics are meant to be small, inexpensive things — shipping them internationally would make them far more expensive than I'm comfortable with. I may change my mind about this on future projects, who knows. For now, if you're outside the US, I recommend embracing digital comics. Go on, embrace them.

blurb1: The creation of a book for YA (& adults) readers featuring stories by author Judith Cullen with artwork by illustrator Rick Geary.
title: "THE BLACKBERRY & Other Tales that Creep"
reward_backer_tup: "Shout Outs" ~ Supporters at this level will get a shout-out thank you during the campaign on my website, as part of the pre-launch postings of selections from the story "Gorak the Gobbler"  which will be part of this book. Those personal thank yous will be included in the facebook and Google+ promotions of these posts.

"Blog Roll" ~ Supporters at this level will be added to a "Gratitutde Roll" that will remain posted at the author's site,  jdcstoryteller.blogspot.com, through the release of the book.  These individuals will also receive a personal Thank You postcard, signed and mailed to them by the author.
"Patrons of the Paper" ~ Supporters at this level will be included in the published book (Kindle and paperback) on a special acknowledgement page thanking them for their support of this project.

"Book Me, Baby!" ~ Supporters at this level will receive a copy of the paperback version of the book when it is released, and will be included on a special acknowledgement page in all versions of the book, thanking them for their support of this project.

"Inksters" ~ Supporters at this level will receive a signed copy of the paperback version of the book when it is released, and will be included on a special acknowledgement page in all versions of the book, thanking them for their support of this project.
risk: Honestly, my major setback has been capital from the very beginning, two years ago.  I was unemployed at the time and started writing/publishing as part of a process of looking for a new direction in my life, professionally, creatively.  You can publish without any substantial outlay – which is to say, produce the data to upload and put a book on the market.

I have always been a storyteller of one kind or another. The people who do hear my stories and read them, love them.  So I know I can write, and I know that people respond to my work. Two years later a few of my books sell every month, even when I am not actively promoting them.

I am still among the working poor.  I am self-employed and my income varies from month to month.  In 2013 I made $10,000, and not all that much more in 2014.  To launch a self-published book “successfully” you need $5000 or more, or so I read in a recent article.  To date my books have been launched on nothing but the $35 I pay one of my proofreaders.  I do all the cover layout and graphics work myself. I am my own marketing department, and I have some excellent friends.  This book, and my work, deserves to take the next step and to move forward. You can help me, and be a part of an important chapter in this journey.

This collection of stories WILL release.  It is just a matter of how fully and completely that happens. Lack of funding means falling back to fewer illustrations in a less finished form, and free distribution channels, just like my previous books.

blurb1: A seven-year portrait of a rural family in Nepal as they experience a windfall of opportunity and then tragically lose it.
title: DRAWING the TIGER: Dash to the World Premiere
reward_backer_tup: The race is on—Thank you! You’ll receive our thanks on Facebook and a digital download of our movie poster. You will also get updates whenever we post to our Drawing the Tiger blog.

Bread and butter (or rice and lentils) level! $25 donors will get the keys to an HD digital download of the completed film*. You will also receive an update whenever we post to our Drawing the Tiger blog. Thank you!
Dhanybhad! (‘Thank you!’ in Nepali) In addition to all of the above, receive a link to our Deluxe Edition of the film with exclusive bonus content*.
A beautifully printed 8x12 archival production still photo for your wall. Plus a really big hug! Thank you so so SO much!
On the screen and on your wall! Your name in the credits! Plus you will receive a triptych of archival 8x12" prints—three original production still photos from Drawing the Tiger.
Behind-the-scenes package: You’ll get keys to an HD stream of Drawing the Tiger with an exclusive commentary track by Amy, Scott, and other crew. Sure to be entertaining and informative!

Solid! Receive Scott’s personalized gearhead consultation: What and how to pack for your off-the-grid/developing world photo/video expedition. Equipment advice, lessons learned and sponsorship strategies that enabled us to shoot far from reliable electricity for weeks at a time, on a budget.
WOW! Great conversation piece, the Limited Edition “Drawing the Tiger” photobook—a beautiful, premium hardcover coffeetable book of still photographs from the project. WOW! Thank you, SO much!
Red Carpet package! Two tickets to our World Premier screening* in Toronto at Hot Docs (actual red carpet not guaranteed; travel not included), and happy hour with the filmmakers. Exciting much?
Red, White and Blue Carpet Package! Two tickets to our U.S. Premier screening* (actual location/dates TBA; travel not included), and happy hour with the filmmakers.

Hungry? A Nepali dinner screening (for backers in the Greater Seattle or Portland areas). We will come to your house with a projector, screen, and dal bhat—the delicious/ubiquitous everyday Nepali meal—to feed up to ten people. Eat with your hands!
Speechless with gratitude! At this level, you will get a special credit in the film's publicity and IMDb entry, as well as receive the Limited Edition “Drawing the Tiger” photobook.
You really care about this film! You will officially be an Associate Producer of the film. This will appear in our credits on subsequent versions, and in our IMDb entry.
Holy of Holies! You will officially be an Executive Producer of the film! This will appear onscreen in subsequent versions of the film, and in our IMDb entry.
risk: Failure is not an option! We have come this far. This film has been SEVEN YEARS in the making. We are DOING this thing!

*Wait, $70,000? Yes. We asked for $51,000 because we felt to ask for the full $70K would be too risky in an all-or-nothing situation like Kickstarter (bless them!) presents. We still need to raise as much as possible.

blurb1: Researchers set off on an adventure to uncover the stories, art, & historical significance of the Macon & Acme Brewing Companies
title: The Acme Brewing Historical Society: Book/Collection Project
reward_backer_tup: Show off the "Power of a Dollar" and feel good immediately knowing you have just helped a Kickstarter campaign move forward in its goal.

You will receive an enthusiastic High-Five and public "Thank You" from one of the four authors. Your small gift is instrumental in helping us bring back historical relics and their stories to Macon.
(Pledges at this level - outside Middle Georgia - will receive our utmost thanks and appreciation virtually - at this very moment!)

A timeless virtual thank you and shout out through our social media channels (this appreciation is stored in the cloud for you to recall at any time and remember how you helped tell a long lost story).

A frame ready, high quality, 8x10 digital print of an Acme Brewing Company Advertisement. These colorful, artistic, and provocative pre-prohibition advertisements were ahead of their time and would have been reference pieces for Sterling Cooper Draper Pryce.
A special edition, limited run, super soft t-shirt featuring the aforementioned artistic advertising and provocative slogans of Acme Brewing.

An autographed copy of the published work and a special print acknowledgement of your support in the foreword. Keep this book for your personal collection and we will donate a copy on your behalf to a library of your choice.

An autographed copy of the published work and a special print acknowledgement of your support in the foreword. Keep this book for your personal collection and we will donate a copy on your behalf to a library of your choice

An autographed copy of the published work and a special print acknowledgement of your support in the foreword. Keep this book for your personal collection and we will donate a copy on your behalf to a library of your choice

A VIP Experience to include, but not limited to, dinner for two with the authors, a walking/driving tour of Macon's brewing history, and an autographed copy of the published work along with a special print acknowledgement of your support in the foreword. Keep this book for your personal collection and we will donate a copy on your behalf to a library of your choice
risk: Research is rewarding and awesome (at least for us) but the expenses can quickly grow as we travel outside of Middle Georgia and across the southeast to gather important information and procure high quality scans and breweriana to flesh out the story of this nearly forgotten piece of Macon (and Southern brewing) history.
We have secured several options for publication - the only significant challenge foreseeable by the research group is securing additional artifacts in a timely manner and at a reasonable cost.

blurb1: Named after the Greek Messenger God Hermes, our mission hopes to deliver your items into near-space (over 30 kilometres high).
title: Project Hermes - Launch Your Messages into Near Space
reward_backer_tup: You will receive all the updates from the mission, be added to the e-mail list, and your name will be included on our website.

--Message Release--
EVERYTHING ABOVE + Your name or a chosen message (nothing inappropriate) will be released into near-space on a small piece of paper when the balloon pops AND your name will be included on the side of the payload.
EVERYTHING ABOVE + You will receive a personalised backers’ certificate by post, and will be given a download for the raw HD video footage from the flight for your own use.

--Bulk Message Release--
The same as the £5 reward, but for 10 messages.

VIP Pack – EVERYTHING ABOVE + You will receive a high quality printed 6×8”photograph from the flight by post, a USB drive with the raw HD footage and be added to the premium backers section on our website.
Epic Pack – EVERYTHING ABOVE + You can send your own small object weighing less than 30g into near space in our payload, and have it returned to you afterwards!

Sponsor Pack – EVERYTHING ABOVE (optional) + Have your company/brand featured on the side of the payload, on our website and Twitter feed, in all certificates and in the video footage in front of the camera.
risk: As with any unmanned flight, there is always a certain risk of losing the payload, whether it be due to tracker malfunction or a fault with the balloon/parachute.

To minimise these risks, we will be using two high quality tracking devices, and reliable well-made and rugged equipment. We will also be constantly monitoring the winds and we will not launch the balloon if the payload is predicted to land anywhere inaccessible.

In the unfortunate but unlikely event that the payload is lost, we will not be able to refund pledges or supply the mission-dependent rewards, however every backer will be contacted with an explanation and apology. If you choose the 'Epic Pack' reward, we are not able to 100% guarantee the safe return of your item, so please do not choose anything valuable or precious to send up in our payload.

title: Dungeons of Aledorn - Old School Hardcore RPG
risk: For video game development, properly planning for everything and anything is a must. We’re hard at work on DoA, and have spent months already planning for this Kickstarter campaign, establishing the schedules and deadlines needed for us to complete DoA once we’re funded.
Everyone working on DoA is very passionate about the project, and will give it their best to make sure that the final product is exactly what backers expect from a quality game they’ve helped create.

The only possible risk we can consider, as is the case with all game development, is a potential delay on the release for the game. We’ll do our best to avoid this, but in case we do end up delaying the release you can rest assured that it would only be in order to polish the game as much as possible so that it can live to the high standards we set for our products, because that is what our backers deserve.
