blurb1: Into the Wintery Gale is a Viking themed adventure written by Justin Andrew Mason for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.
title: Into the Wintery Gale - Pathfinder RPG adventure
reward_backer_tup: Vikmordere Skald – Your name on a "thank you" page in the book, and any applicable "all backers" stretch goal bonuses achieved.
Vikmordere Raider – A digital PDF of the book, and all stretch goal bonuses achieved.
Vikmordere Hero – A softcover color print version of the book (PDF included), and all stretch goal bonuses achieved.

Vikmordere Seer – Help design a random encounter event and get your name in the credits of a published adventure! Vikmordere Seers will work directly with the author to create a theme-specific random encounter! Monster? Trap? Natural Hazard? NPC Interaction? You decide! These events appear in the book as well as on the encounter deck stretch-goal (when unlocked). Inappropriate or vulgar suggestions will prompt request for alternate idea from backer. You will be listed in the credits of the Book and the PDF as a contributor, as well as being likewise credited on the encounter card bearing your concept. 
You also receive a softcover color print version of the book (PDF included), and all stretch goal bonuses achieved. Encounter concepts *must* be provided by April 15th 2015 for us to meet our fulfillment deadline, so please be prepared to communicate with us directly after the Kickstarter ends.

Northern Fury Council Member – Become one of the council of twelve clan chieftains leading the united Vikmordere warriors and shieldmaidens into epic conflict with the Jǫtunn! You send your likeness, which our masterful artists will apply to the character artwork for one of twelve members of the Northern Fury. 
In addition, you will help us to select which clan you will represent, and what sort of resources your clan can offer the player characters to aid them in their quest. 
You will receive a softcover print of the book, the PDF, contributor status in the book credits, and a printed poster of your character artwork. A photograph for artwork likeness *must* be provided by April 15th 2015 for us to meet our fulfillment deadline, so please be prepared to communicate with us directly after the Kickstarter ends.
risk:
For the sake of transparency: AAW Games is still in the process of finishing up and printing/shipping our "Snow White" Pathfinder RPG Kickstarter project, which has now progressed to the editing phase. Authors, artists and cartographers working on "Into the Wintery Gale" are different from those working on the "Snow White" project (or they are individuals who have completed their previous commitments to the "Snow White" project), thus the two projects should have no impact upon one another. From a management perspective, I have confidence and set precedence that the AAW Games team can juggle multiple projects, and you have my word that I will make sure both are properly fulfilled as we have succeeded in doing with our past Kickstarter projects. 
-Jonathan G. Nelson
AAW Games / AdventureAWeek.com
Owner/Publisher

blurb1: Display your spinning top collection and swing away to reveal the perfect spin plate.
title: The Spin Tray
reward_backer_tup: One manually machined solid brass spinning top.  Exclusive Kickstarter design.  For those not ready to commit to The Spin Tray.  $20 below retail.
EARLY BACKER!  The Spin Tray with Walnut or Maple top.  Includes glass spin plate.  $60 below retail.
The Spin Tray with Walnut or Maple top.  Includes glass spin plate.  $37 below retail.
EARLY BACKER!  The Spin Tray with Walnut or Maple top and 1 manually machined solid brass spinning top.  Includes glass spin plate.  $60 below retail.
The Spin Tray with Walnut or Maple top and 1 manually machined solid brass spinning top.  Includes glass spin plate.  $37 below retail.
risk: The biggest challenge, obviously, is jumping into CNC machining and letting the work leave our shop.  I've never been comfortable with this which is why we machine all of our goods manually.  I'm confident, however, in the shop we've chosen to do the work.  The quality is there but, more importantly, the work ethic is equal to ours.  Another challenge will be assembly.  Every base needs a press fit pin with roller bearings which requires a bit of accuracy and time for each.  This is just a matter of spending the time on each and ensuring the quality of the fit.  The final challenge is fulfillment...as always.  This is consistently underestimated by not only myself but other creators.  It's just difficult to predict but, this being my third campaign, I feel like I'm getting a solid grip on the process.

blurb1: Over a day and a night we will record a jazz score for OVER MY DEAD BODY! - a dark screwball comedy set in 1940s Hollywood.

The Red Carpet Package: Receive an HD Digital Download and DVD copy of OVER MY DEAD BODY! plus two tickets to the exclusive London Premiere.

risk: We could release OVER MY DEAD BODY! now, and we would be extremely proud of it. However it wouldn't be living up to its full potential. In that sense, there is very little risk - we are making something better. It's already good.

Meanwhile, within the context of this project alone, the risk is that we will not achieve the exceptional soundtrack that the film requires. The standard of the film is very high, and the soundtrack must match it. With this amount of funding we have only one chance to record.

The musicians we have chosen are professional session musicians, who have a great deal of experience dealing with fast turn-over and tight recording schedules. In terms of our scheduling we will be prioritizing those sections of the film which will benefit the most from scoring and building from there. This will allow us to adjust our schedule if time becomes pressing.

Our composer is already working on the score, and he has an extensive network of musicians to draw on for recording. He has already chosen a shortlist of musicians we will be working with. In the event of sickness or other unavoidable setbacks we have some flexibility with regard to our musicians.

blurb1: CALLING ALL: Backers with a strong thirst for locally made hop forward Belgian ales. IN RETURN: A smorgasbord of super sweet rewards.
title: Brewery ARS: Help Build An Epic Brewery
reward_backer_tup: STICKER: Our beautiful, hand-drawn logo surrounded by a pretty bad ass vintage border.
TOUR: Brothers (and owners) Sean & Andy Arsenault will guide you on the very first radical tour through our finished brewery.
BREWERY ARS T-SHIRT: Our hella amazing logo emblazened large and in charge on a plush 100% cotton t-shirt. Printed locally by the great people over at Awesome Dudes Printing.

THE STARVING ARTIST T-SHIRT: The Starving Artist is an homage to those who take the road less traveled and pursue their own dogged dreams. Though you may be starving at times, may you forever be creatively full. At Brewery ARS, we’re keeping the American dream very much alive. Printed locally by the fantastic people over at Awesome Dudes Printing.
BREWERY ARS GLASSWARE: No lame ass pint glasses here. Our beautiful hand drawn logo adorns a belgian-esque tulip glass. Glassware can and should be beautiful.

BREWERY ARS HOODED SWEATSHIRT: For those of you who prefer your apparel with sleeves, our lovely hand drawn logo adorns a super soft 100% cotton hooded sweatshirt. Printed locally by hand over at Awesome Dudes Printing.
MERCH BUNDLE #1: The sticker, Brewery ARS T-shirt, & Brewery ARS tulip glass.

PRE-OPENING PARTY INVITATION: My brother and I are inviting a select few to our brewery for a super selective gathering of beer geeks and freaks. You will be the very first patrons to taste our eclectic ales.

HAND DRAWN WAYNE'S PALE ALE PRINT: I (Sean, the better looking half of Brewery ARS) will hand draw and color 10 Wayne’s Pale Ale prints. Wayne's Pale Ale is named after our old man, an individual as great as his name. Wayne is enjoying a rebirth of sorts these days. A long time supporter of mass marketed tinkle, Wayne can't get enough of those pungent and dank hops that we've all come to love here at Brewery ARS. Be proud that you purchased this print for Wayne will look over and protect your household from flavorless 'beer'. Cold filtered means absolutely nothing to Wayne anymore and it sure as hell shouldn't mean anything to you.
BREWERY ARS HYDRO FLASK GROWLER: Our beautifully mustachioed logo adorned on Hydro Flask's 64 oz stainless steel double wall vacuum insulated beer growler that will keep your beer cold for 24 hours.

COMMUNITY SUPPORTED GROWLER CLUB - 6 MONTH MEMBERSHIP: When we pick up our veggie/meat/cheese goodness at our local  CSA, there's nothing that we would like more than an ale or two to wash down all of the awesomeness that community supported agriculture provides. What we have here is a 6 month membership to your very own community supported growler club.

BEER & PIZZA PARTY AT OUR HUMBLE ABODE IN SOUTH PHILLY: There is absolutely nothing better than the marriage between homemade pizza and homemade beer. With that being said, my brother and I would like to invite 10 lucky individuals to come to our abode, the birthplace of our brewery, to imbibe in our basement full of forgotten brews and pizza. We take our pizza as serious as we take our beer so don't expect frozen pies. What you can expect are blistering doughs, the perfect tang of domestically grown tomatoes, and a fervent obsession with cheese.
MERCH BUNDLE #2: The sticker, Brewery ARS T-shirt, Brewery ARS tulip glass, & Brewery ARS growler.
COMMUNITY SUPPORTED GROWLER CLUB - 12 MONTH MEMBERSHIP: Take our 6 month membership and double it. Boom.

GREENSTREET COFFEE ROASTERS BEER COLLABORATION: In a city as fanatical about their beer as they are about their coffee, we're offering a fantastic opportunity to collaborate on a coffee infused beer collaboration with those dapper lads over at Greenstreet Coffee Roasters. This reward includes a tour and cupping at Green Street's roasting facility where you will select the bean (or blend of beans) that will ultimately end up in the beer followed by the actual brewing of the beer at our brewing facility in Philadelphia. You will also be in charge of creating the actual beer so creative minds are most definitely welcome. We're all pretty stoked about this collaboration.

LITTLE BABY'S ICE CREAM BEER COLLABORATION: What we have here is a beer infused ice cream collaboration with those wild and wacky dudes over at Little Baby's Ice Cream. This reward will include a meeting of the minds between Brewery ARS, Little Baby's Ice Cream, and a select few backers were we will throw our inhibitions to the wind, drink way to much beer and eat way too much ice cream. Once we have decided upon a recipe, we will head over to Little Baby's world headquarters in East Kensington, roll up our sleeves, and churn out some serious goodness. Please choose this reward if you're willing to get weird, very weird. Each backer will be handsomely rewarded with 2 pints of the collaboration ice cream.

'T GAVERHOPKE COLLABORATION: We're offering a once in a life time opportunity to create a beer together with 'T Gaverhopke, one of the best breweries in the world. Yes, the world. It's a bold statement, but if you've ever had their extra, then you're probably singing the same tune as us. 'T Gaverhopke will join us in Philadelphia for one grand Belgo-American collaboration beer. Each backer will walk away with two growlers of the collaboration beer along with some serious bragging rights that you made a beer with one of the best breweries in the world.
risk: We're offering a lot of different rewards and a fairly ambitious community supported growler program. It is possible that our growler program will not start on time due to licensing and production delays. We will notify all of our backers immediately if such a delay does arise and will keep everyone in the loop as to the timing of everyone's first growler pick up.

It is possible that there may be a delay with our collaboration with 'T Gaverhopke. As 'T Gaverhopke is located in Belgium, the timing of the collaboration will depend upon when they can make the trip over from Europe. We will do our best to keep the 5 lucky backers up to date if there are any such delays to 'T Gaverhopke's arrival in the US.

risk: The biggest challenge I've faced thus far is scaling production. With a product that hinges on being hand-crafted, it can be hard to meet demand while staying committed to that vision.

Building a custom letterpress will allow me to make small runs of pre-hand-lettered package artwork with less overhead than using a commercial letterpress. Also, it will allow me greater interaction with each box, preserving the hand-made element that's so central to this idea.

In the event the letterpress doesn't work out — say it breaks, or the runs produce a lower quality product than I'm willing to share with you — screen printing is a perfectly simple and viable backup. Either way, your template-design boxes will show up on your recipient's doorstep looking beautiful.

risk: Usability

With any complicated machine, one risks that the interface and use may be complicated. In order to mitigate this risk, we are developing easy to use software and methods to make the PancakeBot intuitive and easy to use.  We will also be developing instructional videos on best practices for drawing pancakes.
Batter Variations

There are many recipes for Pancake batter out there.  Everything ranging from clumpy pancakes to gluten free.  The main difference is typically batter viscosity.  In order to address this, we have provided adjustments that allow you to change the air pressure in the dispenser to fine tune the dispensing of the batter.
We also provide a pancake recipe that has been used from the get-go which is a variation of Martha Stewarts Basic Pancake Recipe.
Warranty

We provide a warranty on all of our products shipped and sold into the USA.  Since we are USA based with all of our infrastructure here, we don’t have the ability to take returns or offer warranty support in any foreign territories.  We are working hard to find appropriate regional distributors who will bear the responsibility for service and support outside of North America.

title: Lumioto - LED Prototyping Tool (Powered by Arduino)
risk: Lumioto is extremely mature. The design has already been manufactured and tested in small quantities with the same processes we’ll use for production. This Kickstarter is needed to gauge interest and get our first manufacturing run into economically viable volumes. None of the development is being funded here. That's already done.

But anything can happen. The biggest risk now is that a kink in the supply chain could cause delays. Lumioto is made from lots of parts that come from many reliable sources, and while they are all readily available right now, nothing lasts forever. Maybe someone will buy up all the little knobs I need, and we’ll have to wait 12 weeks for more. Maybe the manufacturer of the driver chips will suddenly stop making them and I’ll have to redesign around an alternative. Maybe I’ll get a wonky batch of LEDs from the factory and have to send them back for the right ones. I’ve done everything that can be done to secure and vet suppliers, but some things are just out of my hands. No matter what, I’m confident that even if there are delays, promises to backers will be fulfilled.

risk: All hardware products carry associated risks and challenges. The Uamp team has been working hard to address every one of them.

Our first priority will be sound quality and product reliability. The biggest challenges facing these goals are: being able to deliver our product on time without cutting corners, and unforeseen circumstances.

Delivering the product within the estimated time frame is difficult. To deal with unforeseen circumstances we have developed a strong contingency plan, which includes seeking out back-up manufacturers and suppliers, as well as working with experienced partners (who have been through this process many times).

risk: There are always significant challenges in manufacturing and delivering any hardware product at scale. Mass manufacturing isn't the same as prototype development; besides making the Core work, we have to make sure they are secure and reliable, and that they can be manufactured efficiently at larger volumes.

Fortunately, we've been living and working in China, and have been working on ONetSwitch45/20 project since 2013.Of course, there are still risks associated with producing the ONetSwitch. Unexpected changes in component lead times, availability, and cost are examples of factors outside our direct control that could affect our delivery timeline, but we are working hard to mitigate those risks and plan to be transparent throughout the delivery process.

risk: As with any start-up company, there is no one way to mitigate risks going forward. I have worked extremely hard to ensure Neon Moon was truly ready for Kickstarter and ensured a methodical large scale manufacturing process within the UK just incase! So here are the potential risks that may arise, and how I intend to combat them head on!

MANUFACTURING: During the sampling stage of Neon Moon’s first collection there were delays, and I have definitely learnt how to ensure the process runs smoother. As factories within the UK are mainly CMT, I will ensure that I have all the components manufactured with enough time to then move to the factory. To minimise all risk of manufacturing setbacks, I have lined up at least one back-up manufacturer within the UK. I will be working alongside extremely experienced manufacturers whose businesses have been around for longer than I have been alive! This will hopefully mitigate a lot of risk surrounding the Neon Moon bra and knickers manufacturing.

FULFILLMENT: Unforeseen circumstances like lost shipments, wrong sizing, late shipments can’t be planned for, but dealt with. These matters can create delays. In order to minimise the risk all shipments of the Neon Moon bras/knickers (within the UK and abroad) will have tracking and signature on arrival. A full size chart (beyond the scope of UK 8-10, 10-12, 12-14) will be sent to all backers emails and uploaded on the website / social media before shipments are finalised in order to mitigate wrong sizing. All UK sizing will be as true to size as possible, with the expertise of the manufacturer.
THANK YOU for reading - I really hope you choose to support Neon Moon on Kickstarter today!

risk: This Kickstarter Campaign has been created to generate funds to enable the creation of more of the glass floats to be hidden on the island, pay for operating expenses, purchase materials, and to ensure that this event becomes a yearly tradition on Block Island. Starting in late April/early May, we will begin creating the hundreds of glass floats needed to hide around the island. Making glass is an incredibly expensive venture and we need your help to get the ball rolling!! The funds we are seeking from this kickstarter campaign will go towards purchasing raw materials, paying for the propane and electricity that run our equipment, and other operating expenses that have to be paid to make all of this work. Without help from our kickstarter supporters, we will have to cut back on the number of floats that we would like to hide on the island next year... Less floats hidden obviously means that there will be less floats to be found!! One major change that is planned for 2015 is the hiding of smaller numbers of floats more frequently, so that the chances of finding them are spread out throughout the season. I really want YOU to find a float when YOU come to the island.. This will require more trips to the island, and more hikes around the island to hide them, but it will ensure that the odds of finding one will be better.

risk: We consider this a very low-risk project. The art is complete with a few minor exceptions. We just need to get the books printed. So the primary challenges for this project are printing and shipping.

Dealing with any large print run involves some risks. As two examples, books may be misprinted, or books may be damaged when shipped from the printer. We're going with Print Ninja, which has a good track record for both of these. Since we're getting these printed abroad, customs might cause delays, but Eric knows some international trade attorneys and should be able to shake them loose.

Then there is shipping from us to you. We are planning on using USPS Priority Mail to ship all the packages. Not only will USPS provide us with free boxes, but they are flat rate as long as we're under 4 pounds. So even if we get stretch goals that include a second volume, our shipping rate is the same. We've already checked the packaging and they will fit two volumes. Using priority mail also means that you will get your rewards faster with less chance of packages being lost in the mail.
We will inform you of any additional challenges that may arise. One thing we've learned from launching a webcomic is to be ready to handle the unexpected.

blurb1: Blades in the Dark is a tabletop RPG about a crew of daring scoundrels building a criminal empire in a haunted city full of thieves.

reward_backer_tup: RECON: This reward gets you backer-only updates and sneak peeks at the game.

In addition, you also get the source files for the game, artwork, handout materials, and all the maps, so you can edit them and make your own hacks or new additions to the game. THE HACKER: You get everything from the HARDCASE level. In addition, you also get the source files for the game, artwork, handout materials, and all the maps, so you can edit them and make your own hacks or new additions to the game.

In addition, you’ll have the option to send me a photograph of yourself (or a friend, with their permission) and I'll transform it into a cool scoundrel portrait. I'll add your portrait to a set of wanted posters of notable criminals in the game book. You'll also get the high-resolution file to use however you like.
FOUR HARDCOVERS: You get everything from the HACKER level but you get four hardcover books instead of one. A great gift for everyone in your game group.
CREW PORTRAIT: This is just like the SCOUNDREL PORTRAIT level, but you get a portrait of your whole crew! Send me up to 4 photos and I'll make an illustration of the group together.

In addition, you get to help me create one of the underworld factions of Duskwall, based on the crew and characters from your home game group. They'll be added to the canonical faction ladder, with a full faction entry, details of their lair and goals, and descriptions of their notable characters. I'll also provide a custom piece of artwork (their lair and a portrait of the crew) to accompany the entry, and you'll get the high res artwork, too.

risk: I wear all the hats here at One Seven Design: game design, writing, layout, illustration, cartography -- the whole shebang. It's tough but rewarding work that I've been doing for over 20 years. Which is long enough to learn how to manage the challenges and obstacles that crop up with every project.
Fortunately, a lot of my peers have already pioneered delivery of games on Kickstarter like this, to great success. I'm following in their footsteps.

The game is very close to finished. The design has been playtested and refined for the past 26 months and about half of the book is written. The design style and layout templates are done. What remains is a chunk of explanatory writing and lots and lots of art and map-making.

I expect there will be tweaks and changes as you all start playing the Quick Start, which I'm very excited about. I will remain transparent about the process  -- keeping you informed of revisions and progress as I go along.

If funded, this project will pay for more art, more maps, and more great content for the game. I'm excited to devote all of my attention to the game to see it to completion with all the care and craftsmanship I have to give.

blurb1: I'll be publishing not one, but TWO sequels to my humorous fantasy novel, Disenchanted: Disillusioned and Distopia.
title: The Dis Trilogy - A series of humorous epic fantasy novels
risk: This is my fourth Kickstarter. I have successfully funded and published three other novels through Kickstarter: Schrodinger's Gat, Mercury Revolts and City of Sand. Disillusioned and Distopia will be my eleventh and twelfth novels, respectively. Most of my novels have taken less than two months to write; Disenchanted took me about six weeks. I did go a few weeks over the projected deadline with City of Sand because the book ended up about 10,000 words longer than I expected, so I've padded this project by a few extra weeks just in case.

I've done this so many times that the only real risks are the possibility of health problems or some act of God (asteroid striking Earth, zombie apocalypse, etc.) that prevent me from writing. I will inform supporters of any roadblocks as I become aware of them and refund your money if I am unable to fulfill the goals of the project.

blurb1: For my senior project, I plan to build a Dobsonian Reflector Telescope that will allow me to view all kinds of celestial bodies.
title: Telescope Senior Project - Elkins High School - 2015
reward_backer_tup: Your name included in the thank you slide in the presentation at my school.

The previous two rewards, plus a special thank you card handwritten by me!
risk: Building a telescope is relatively hard and delicate work. The mirrors have to be treated very carefully so as not to scratch or mark the surface in any way. Assembling all of the pieces will  be difficult for me as well, because I chose a project that would challenge me more than just intellectually. I have very little construction skill so I am relying on friends and internet guides to help me finish this and have it look right and function. Even if the telescope is built correctly, I will still have to spend a lot of time properly aligning and focusing the mirrors and lens. If the project is not successfully funded, I may have to look elsewhere for funding, or scrap the idea and think of something else quickly.

risk: The largest challenges have already been overcome. We have finished the concept art and paid for the sculpting for the project. The only remaining obstacle would be something disastrous happening to our resin caster, which would require finding a new caster. However, given our multi-year working relationship, that should be in the long odds category.
Given that we already successfully handled 4 previous Chibi miniatures projects (200+ new figurines) we have learned the most important lessons we needed to ensure this project is a success.
Our last 3 Chibi projects have been delivered between 2 month early and 2 months late so no major delays wondering if you will ever get your miniatures.

For full disclosure, we currently have three outstanding KickStarter for new dice suitable for use with Dungeon Crawl Classics, Fantasy Football miniatures, and Earthdawn miniatures. All of these projects are in motion and should be fully shipped out before these figures should be ready for shipping so there should be no problems with timing due to our other projects.

risk: Hi this is David MacKenzie of Game Designers Clubhouse. Daily Magic Productions has asked me to be their Kickstarter Manager as well as their Production Manager for Valeria: Card Kingdoms, and I am grateful for the trust they've put in my abilities.

I've been running Kickstarter projects since April 2010 (Alien Frontiers). I've worked independently, I've worked for a mainstream publisher, and, as I'm doing here, I've managed projects as a gun-for-hire. I've definitely been around the block a few times and seen the extremes at both ends of the Kickstarter roller coaster. No matter how much experienced a project manager has, things can run smoothly, or they can hit bumps along the way. I can only make you one meaningful promise -- I will do my best to make it all go to plan and I will be honest and open throughout. Thank you for your support.
--David MacKenzie

Daily Magic Productions is committed to delivering quality products. We realize that the publication of a board game can be complicated and some problems may occur. In an effort to reduce the likelihood of delays and mistakes, we have taken several steps to prepare and set ourselves up for success:

1. We have hired David MacKenzie as a Production Manager for the entirety of game development, the Kickstarter campaign, game production, and various other tasks. His years of experience will help us tackle any issues that may come our way.

2. We are dedicated to backer communication and player feedback. As David runs the campaign, he will be as transparent about the process and open to feedback as he can be without putting timelines for delivery in jeopardy.

3. We have done significant pre-production and have all the art for the  game completed and the graphic design is nearly complete. With our years of digital game development, we learned the value of pre-production work and know that it saves time and money at the end of the project.
4. With the help of David, we have contacted several manufacturers to find us the best quality at the best price. We have the production quote ready and can initiate production in short order.
5. We have done rigorous play-testing on Valeria: Card Kingdoms. Not only has it been continuously tested at Game Designers Clubhouse, but we have shipped prototypes all over the world.

We hope that everything goes as planned, but if something falls through the cracks, we are ready and willing to put every tool at our disposal as a seasoned and successful game development company to make the project run smoothly.
Thank you for your support!

AIRSTREAM IMMORTALITY II: Life-sized full-body portrait of you inside the Airstream in the pose of your choice*, painted by a local artist, with an accompanying plaque expressing our gratitude.
risk: As a community radio station operating with over 65 volunteer DJs out of an Airstream trailer on the Taos Mesa, we've been facing risks and challenges left and right since we dove into this project early last year. We've been doing our level best to tackle the risks and challenges as they arise, and look at each one as an opportunity to hold true to our vision for the station.

Currently, our greatest challenges arise from the financial and time constraints that come with trying to maintain a truly community-oriented media project of this nature. We've been operating off of a lot of volunteer hours and a bare-bones budget, and much hangs on the success of this particular arm of the venture to help everyone in the KNCE community feel confident that we're moving forward.

We're not exactly sure how long this tower move will take, as we've never done anything like it before and, honestly, you just can't accurately predict timelines when dealing with this amount of paperwork and bureaucracy. But we're extremely excited about the move, and the potential it will open up for KNCE's growth. And we feel confident that with your support, we can ensure that KNCE will be a staple voice in grassroots community media for years to come.

risk: So goes the saying: "Paper can take anything!", and consumer agreements do. Not all agreements are logically sound and may not translate into logically consistent structures. In such cases, we intend to work with vendors towards resolution, case by case.

Legally binding terms may not have single interpretation. Different experts my interpret same terms in a different way. This is why we have courts. A significant feature of our technology is ability to introduce a new variable and, when needed, offer a choice of interpretation.

Scalability! Supporting a network of millions is a fundamentally different challenge of supporting a network of thousands. We have already touched upon this issue in a "Scenario If Project Overfunded". However, if it turns out that number of backers approach the limits of our technology, scalability will be addressed with high priority.

blurb1: Slave To The Grind is the first feature length documentary on Grindcore
title: Slave To The Grind - A Film About Grindcore
risk: Making a film involves significant risk.  Documentaries are the riskiest.

Having shot a feature doc before, I was able to make most of my rookie mistakes: going over budget, underestimating how long it would take, taking too much on, etc. That said, I was still able to complete, tour, and sell the documentary to a variety of outlets.  I am confident that even in these early stages of production, Slave to the Grind will surpass our previous projects.
Risk 1: Subjects refuse to be involved in the project

This has been my fear from day one, but I am happy to say that 95% of the people I have reached out to have been keen on being interviewed.  The other 5% are a work in progress.  I am very persistent.
Risk 2: Delays

Delays are inevitable, but they should not be seen as setbacks.  Ideally, a delay is deliberate and are intended to make the film better.  Let's say Lee Dorrian is going to be in my neighborhood performing a solo grind show the day after the film is supposed to be completed. This is when I would push the release back to get what I need.  Making a documentary is all about waiting for a story, and while this film will be rooted in grind's history, it is imperative that I am capturing grindcore's present and future development.
Risk 3: Technology

I teach film studies for a living, and most of my day is spent fixing technological errors. Computer crashes, hard-drives frying, broken gear...I can sort out any issue timely and efficiently.  We are beyond backed up, and this film will only be stronger as a result of any technological error.
Risk 4: Getting too close

This risk is more for those who make films, than for the grindcore fans out there.  What if I lose objectivity as a grindcore fan?  What if this just ends up being a fanboy film, and has no social perspective outside of our little community?  I am dedicated to making this film the best it can be.  Both of my cinematographers do NOT listen to grindcore, and my two editors don't like heavy metal in the slightest.  It allows for me (Director, Doug Brown) to guide the film in terms of artistic vision and general 'grind-knowledge' so that grindheads get what they want and let the other team members assist with flow, story, and the human element that makes a good documentary.

blurb1: High school students design & build a traditional darkroom to process and print images from a Chihuahuan Desert photography expedition.
title: The Chihuahuan Desert- A Student Photography Expedition
reward_backer_tup: 1 PIN-BACK BUTTON! Who doesn't love a button? This custom button highlights an amazing photograph from our expedition.
SET OF 8 POSTCARDS! Love snail mail?This postcard set includes photographs taken during our expedition that explore the beauty of the Chihuahuan Desert.
MINI PHOTO BOOK! Tiny things are cool too, right? This small photo book will be packed with images taken during our expedition.
ORIGINAL DARKROOM PRINT! This will be a  hand-printed (old school style) photograph from our new darkroom. We will select the perfect photograph for you taken during our expedition.
COFFEE TABLE BOOK! You need one of these, for sure. This large book will impress you with its variety of original photographs taken during our expedition.
risk: 12 high school kids, 1 teacher, 2 river guides, 1 international border, throw in some camera equipment, a desert, and several canoes not to mention a student designed and constructed darkroom, tools, new equipment, and the hectic end of the school year  ….what could possibly go wrong??? It’s highly likely that things will not go as planned, but that’s okay. Failure, problem- solving, flexibility, a sense of humor and initiative all are important in the education process, encouraging the growth of students and teacher. The difficulties we will encounter will be different for each part of our project.

During our photography expedition, there are several things not in our control and our desert environment offers unique challenges. Inclement weather, low or high river levels, equipment accidents and adventurer accidents are just a few of the possibilities. Background knowledge and adaptability are our focus for this part of our project. We have been preparing for our trip, brainstorming, and making lists! We are being as informed as possible, discussing needed supplies and equipment, proper clothing, weather protection, and student concerns. We have chosen experience guides to help us along the way.

The design and construction of our darkroom will hold its own challenges. As we near the end of the school year, it becomes hectic. In our small school, students and staff are involved in a multitude of activities and have numerous responsibilities. Our focus will be to plan and follow a tight, but realistic schedule to complete the darkroom. We also have the option of asking for help from our school community and parents. We have engaged in other large scale projects and feel we are prepared to meet the challenges of any obstacles that arise.

risk: Most everyone is familiar with the delays and problems that Art and Film Projects can potentially have. risk: I've never printed a book before but I know that any new venture incurs risk.

To help make sure this thing works out the best it can, I've decided to work with a local printing company that specializes in helping independent creators publish crowdfunded projects. I'm going to be leaning on their expertise to help make sure that the quality of the book and the pipeline from concept to delivery goes smoothly.

Will this be late? Probably. Every campaign I've run has been delivered late no matter how much I prepare for it. I can't promise shit won't happen, but I do promise to be transparent about it and as helpful as I can before, during and after this project gets funded.

risk: This project and the creation of BBP Inc have both been incredible learning experiences, and not without hurdles.

Our first publication, "Marin" by Katherine Agard was similarly funded through a Kickstarter campaign, and was due out in late February 2015. We had planned to hand print and bind each of these beautifully crafted artist books, but ran into technical issues with our perfect binding machine that have caused us to postpone this launch until early April 2015.

Self publishing is a sharp learning curve. We learned a lot through the process of this first publication, not least of which is the importance of working with and learning from other members of the field.

With these two publications (and also with the binding of "Marin") we are working with - and being advised by - two wonderful publishing companies that work with small presses across the country to realize and manufacture their works.

blurb1: Marketing guru Andi is pushed by her best friends to finally tackle the one thing she can't brand - herself, single and dating, in NYC.
title: Rebranding Andi - a web series
reward_backer_tup: You get a karmic high five (yeah!) and the satisfaction of knowing that you are helping funny people do funny things. Oh, and bragging rights.  Sweet, I know.

You get all the aforementioned karma, satisfaction and braggery, plus a shout out on our Facebook page and website (coming soon...)  It's up to you if you want it to be your real name or your Tinder alias. (Unless you are related to me. What's Tinder?!)

You get all previously mentioned goodies, PLUS a signed poster with the three leading ladies. Odds are good that at least one of us is gonna make it for our tomfoolery, and then you'll be able to rest easy knowing your grandkids will get at least one thing pop-culture-cool in your estate someday. (No, they don't want your mp3s or ebooks. Sorry.)
You get the sweet swag listed above, and a verbal shout-out on our season finale.  What?!

You get it all, AND a day on set while we're shooting if you live in NYC or wanna shuttle your sweet face here. No, this is not code for cast and crew coffee runner.  Unless you really, really like Starbucks.  Then why fight the feeling? [Cue: REO Speedwagon]

Not only do you get all the offerings being offered, you even get to have a role as an extra in one of our episodes! If you're lucky, you can play someone one of the characters bonked in college.  And yes, that offer is valid regardless of sex or age, unless you are younger than 25. (There are laws about this, people! And if you are under 25 and have $1000 to donate to a Kickstarter campaign, who are you?! Do tell. :-) )

Congratulations!  You are officially an executive producer of Rebranding Andi!  You are a smart person.  You also basically own me.  You get to ask me for a big favor.  I'm open to suggestions, however, know that requests to clean your apartment or house while scantily clad will be reported to the appropriate authorities.  (Which is probably just my father.  He has many guns.  I wouldn't push it.)
risk: There are always risks and challenges with every creative endeavor, but we aren't too fazed by them.  Getting to create a piece of work that shares a comedic point of view that might touch others or make them laugh is well worth overcoming the obstacles.

That said, our biggest challenges will be working with the schedules of all of the talented people who are the cast and crew of this series and getting access to some of our shooting locations.  (Getting an office space to use as a film set in Manhattan is a hair-pulling mission; if you have any leads and can lend a hand, let us know!)

Not only will professional involvement ensure that the film is completed on time, it will also allow our creative vision to be fully realized so as to be shared with wider audiences through promotion and festival submissions.

4. Order spinners (check), tokens (check), scratch pads, timers (check).

I found a company that specializes in making playing cards. They even successfully ran their own Kickstarter last year: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/makeplayingcards/impressions-playing-cards…

I think the biggest obstacle is to finish writing all of the questions for the cards. There will be hundreds of questions. I have given myself ample time to be able to write them from now until May. I also plan on having my students help me write as many as we can. In this way, I will have 60 collaborators writing questions.

reward_backer_tup: Have your passion for the sea celebrated in the SIRENE log book. Tell us about you and your relationship with the sea and we will publish it in a log book on our sirenejournal.com.

Get a copy of the first issue of SIRENE + an original Italian Navy t-shirt featuring the SIRENE logo. Men sizes.
Get a copy of the first issue of SIRENE + a SIRENE canvas sailor bag featuring the magazine logo. When you go to sea, you really need only a few things. Put them all into your new bag!

Come spend some time with the SIRENE crew and try an unforgettable sailing experience for two days on a lateen sailboat in the gulf of Portofino in Italy (you must cover all costs getting and staying there). Oh, of course you’ll get a copy of SIRENE, a t-shirt and a sailor bag featuring the magazine logo too. Prepare for terrific sunny days!

A big reward: a weekend of regattas during the “Voiles Latines at Saint Tropez (May, 29-31st, 2015)” on board the 1959 wooden boat Nessuno (basic sailing skills required, you must cover all costs getting and staying there). Join one of the most exciting rally of the circuit, gathering every year more than 50 old sailboats! Oh, of course you’ll get a copy of SIRENE, a t-shirt and a sailor bag featuring the magazine logo too.

SIRENE: a mermaid as a muse.
The final and most precious of our rewards makes us proud and elated: a mermaid especially created by artist-designer Nacho Carbonell to support the launch of SIRENE! It consists of a unique piece in metal and concrete that renews the ancient myth of mermaids in the coarse and contemporary language of the famous Spanish artist, collected by the likes of Brad Pitt and other celebrities. A piece that a sea-loving art&design collector shouldn't miss! 
You will get of course also a copy of SIRENE, a branded t-shirt and a sailor bag.
risk:
RISKS
The number of readers that are actually interested in this kind of literary offer is not large enough to make the project viable.

OPPORTUNITIES
Supporting SIRENE means, on one hand, relying on a psychological drive – the attraction of man for water – on the other hand, pledging on a medium that, by including the discussion of green themes, gets involved into one of the most important contemporary debates and which is highly likely to have an influence on the public in the near future.
Supporting SIRENE means allocating a relatively low budget for an experimental project involving a new editorial/commercial model.

Pledging on SIRENE means laying your money on something pleasing. Betting on the clean side of the planet, on the ocean’s vital force that can join communities and cultures that would otherwise be far and different. 
It means being somehow a protagonist where the passion for water is celebrated, whether it is a lateen sail regatta in the Mediterranean Sea, or a surfing competition in the Pacific Ocean.

risk: Everybody knows the dire statistics that face a cafe opening in New York City. Not only am I starting this business without debt, I have done extensive research on the coffee business in general, in New York specifically, and in Bed-Stuy/Clinton Hill even more specifically. This neighborhood is far from its saturation point of good coffee, and there is nothing like Stonefruit available without getting on the train. Meanwhile, the healthy food business is sky-rocketing-- consumers have more knowledge at their fingertips than ever before, and the success of Whole Foods trumpets an era when we are all a little pickier about what we eat.

I am also building an inspiring team, including an incredibly committed and skilled architect who will see the project through construction, a nutrition coach/assistant manager to help run the cafe while keeping it true-to-vision, and an experienced chef devoted to seasonal produce and interesting flavor profiles.

Follow along with our progress on our blog: www.stonefruit.co
And by following us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/stonefruit.co…

blurb1: Dennis Hopper's final film is nearly complete, but we need YOUR help for the final push!
title: The Last Film Festival: Dennis Hopper's Unseen Final Film
reward_backer_tup: HALL OF FAME - We cannot thank you enough for your support! You will receive all the updates on the project and exclusive video content and will also be listed in the credits on our website! Thanks for believing in us!
PDF SCRIPT - You’ll get a PDF of the script on the day of the film's release as well as behind-the-scenes updates on production status.
SOUNDTRACK - We love our soundtrack and we believe you will too! Stream the soundtrack to your computer ahead of the film's release.

DIGITAL DOWNLOAD OF THE FILM - You will receive a digital download of The Last Film Festival to be enjoyed at home or with friends!  (Please do not duplicate or distribute. This film has been years in the making and deserves more!)
T-SHIRT DESIGN - You will receive a limited edition T-Shirt featuring the designs from the set of The Last Film Festival, artwork by Kathleen Whelen.

T-SHIRT DESIGN - Due to popular demand we have added more T-SHIRT DESIGN pledges. You will receive a limited edition T-Shirt featuring the designs from the set of The Last Film Festival, artwork by Kathleen Whelen.
DVD  - You get the DVD copy of The Last Film Festival and exclusive behind the scenes footage before anyone else (you lucky dog)!
BUNDLE PACK - You will receive the Digital Download of the film, the Soundtrack, a PDF of the script AND the Hall of Fame pledge! Now that's what we call a bundle!

POSTER - We want to share with you some of the wonderful designs from the set of The Last Film Festival, courtesy of Kathleen Whelen. These are frameable and perfect for film buffs and to show off to family and friends.
VIP SCREENING AND Q&A IN LONDON - Attend an exclusive screening of the film in London and enjoy a Q&A with the director Linda Yellen after the film.
VIP SCREENING AND Q&A IN LA - Attend an exclusive screening of the film in LA and enjoy a Q&A with the director Linda Yellen after the film.
VIP SCREENING AND Q&A IN NEW YORK - Attend an exclusive screening of the film in New York and enjoy a Q&A with the director Linda Yellen after the film.
VISIT DENNIS' COMPOUND - See the residential/work compound Dennis built in Venice, California.  Tour the building Frank Gehry designed.

SIGNED POSTER - Not only are you getting the best poster in town, but it’s also signed by cast and crew! Including Joseph Cross, JoBeth Williams, Jacqueline Bissett, Linda Yellen, and cinematographer Mauricio Rubenstein,

SIGNED DENNIS HOPPER CATALOG - Courtesy of the Gagosian Gallery in London, signed catalog of photos from Dennis Hopper’s 2014 "Drugstore Camera” Exhibition, featuring exclusive photographs and content and signed by Linda Yellen.

SIGNED HEADSHOT - You will receive a limited edition signed photo from your choice of Jacqueline Bisset, Chris Kattan , Donnell Rawlings, JoBeth Williams or Joseph Cross. Something great to highlight your contribution to The Last Film Festival.

SPECIAL THANKS - We want to give back by prominently highlighting your name (or a loved one) in the Special Thanks in the credits of The Last Film Festival. You will also receive our genuine thanks on IMDB.

SPECIAL THANKS - Due to popular demand we have added more SPECIAL THANKS rewards, and want to give back by prominently highlighting your name (or a loved one) in the Special Thanks in the credits of The Last Film Festival. You will also receive our genuine thanks on IMDB.
PRODUCTION EXECUTIVE - Imagine your name in lights! Your name will in the film credits as an Production Executive and you will receive an Production Executive credit on IMDB.

GET READY FOR OUR DATEBOO! - While Donnell Rawlings tours the US, he's making himself available for 5 lucky backers! This is your chance to grill him on everything from The Last Film Festival to life on Chappelle's Show. His stops along the way include: Palm Beach, Detroit, Buffalo, Nashville, San Antonio, Bellevue,WA, Baltimore, Washington D.C.

SOHO HOUSE LUNCH BUNDLE - Lunch is on us when you meet Director Linda Yellen at the famous Soho House in NYC.  Plus, you'll also receive a Digital Download or Signed DVD + PDF of script + Hall of Fame + a VIP ticket to a screening of your choice.

SKYPE WITH THE LEGENDARY DEAN STOCKWELL - Dean Stockwell was a lifelong, close friend of Dennis Hopper.  He worked with Dennis in The Last Movie and Blue Velvet. Like Dennis, Dean has a home in Taos, New Mexico, and a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.

DINNER WITH THE STARS - You get to have a wonderful dinner with Jacqueline Bisset in Los Angeles, and find out more about what it was like being involved in Dennis Hopper’s last film. Don’t worry kid, we got the bill.
RENT YOUR LOCAL THEATER - We rent out your local theater and gather your friends and Dennis Hopper fans together, for an exclusive screening of the film.
ASSOCIATE PRODUCER - Imagine your name in lights! Your name will be listed in the film as an Associate Producer and you will receive an Associate Producer credit on IMDB.
CO-PRODUCER - Hey big spender! You will be credited as a co-producer of the film! Your name will be in the credits and you will also be credited on IMDB. Welcome to the big time!

DINE LIKE A STAR! - New York City's LE VEAU D'OR  has been the "in" place dating back to the 1930s. Loved by celebrities like Orson Welles, Marlene Dietrich, Truman Capote, Grace Kelly and modern day stars including our very own Dennis Hopper!
It's dinner for four on us, and you will each leave with your very own The Last Film Festival Goodie Bag, plus 4 tickets to a VIP Screening in the city of your choice!
risk: Our goal is to bring The Last Film Festival to the public the way it was meant to be seen when we filmed it. We want you to see the film that Dennis and the rest of us had so much fun making. Although we could go down the traditional route in pursuit of funding, that would involve compromises we aren't willing to make. We want to preserve the original vision of the film and begin showing it at film festivals in 2015.

Since we are so far along in completing the film, we face fewer risks than many films seeking funding on Kickstarter. Once the money is raised we will be able to move full-speed ahead to complete the post-production work and head straight for the film festivals.

One of our challenges will be reaching older Dennis Hopper fans who might not be as media savvy as many Kickstarter users, so we are relying on your help to spread the word to them!
We also face the challenge that many other projects face of delivering rewards on time. While we are confident that we have built in enough time including delivery, we realize that some unforeseen delays could arise. If that happened, we would let people know and hope for their understanding, but with your support, we see clear skies ahead!

risk: Here are the steps of my process:

Step 1)  Editing. The editing required four passes, done off and on during the last four years. I had a lot of journal material to work with.  One issue was to edit this down to a publishable size.  Another task was to give each entry a rounded-off and standalone quality, making them like little stories or essays.

Step 2) Book design. This involved cleaning up and standardizing the formats of the component manuscripts.  I imported the final text document into InDesign desktop publishing software, experimenting with several possible layouts. I experimented with a two-volume layout, but I decided it would work better to have a single large book.  I went through several rounds of printing proofs. And I used the services of proofreaders to hunt down the typos.

Step 3) Cover design. I designed the cover art myself, using my oil painting based on a photograph of me diving in Jellyfish Lake in Palau.  To get a nice-looking final design, I got help from my daughter Georgia Rucker, who is a professional book designer.

Step 4) Production. I export my InDesign book files in the PDF format and send them to Amazon Create Space and to Ingram Lightning for producing paper-backs and hardbacks.  I can also export EPUB format ebooks from InDesign, and it's relatively easy to convert these to the Kindle-friendly MOBI format, using the Sigil and the Calibre software for this task.

Step 5) Distribution. I sell the ebooks via Amazon and my own Transreal Books site, sometimes using other ebook sites a well.. I sell the paperbacks and hardbacks via Amazon and Barnes & Noble, and I distribute the paperbacks and hardbacks to retail stores via Amazon and/or via Lightning.
I've published several Transreal Books titles by now, and I'm confident that I can take my JOURNALS through the necessary steps.

risk: There are some creative risks in this project: working with new sound designs, creating something outside of my usual "comfort zone", and giving up some of my creative control by handing the project to a mix engineer to finish the album.

To help me face this risk, I'm working with producer Russel Walder, who produced my previous album "The Day I Met Myself" (Best Neo-Classical Album of 2012, ZMR Awards). With Russel's wisdom and guidance, I will be able to push through the next "wall" and create something bold and exciting. I'll also be working with a renowned mix engineer.
The challenge will be in working with a large ensemble of live musicians (as many as 17 string players), and integrating their performance into the electronics, piano, and keyboards.
To meet this challenge, I'll be working with a seasoned group of professional musicians in a renowned New York City recording studio, and an Academy award-winning engineer.

risk: As with any piece of original devised theatre, the end product is never fully realised until opening night. This, however, is the thrill of new devised work. 'Shooting with Light' will be our 6th production to date and we have successfully worked together over 10 years, problem solving all manner of issues running a theatre company brings. We have taken it all in our stride and wholly believe in our abilities and in Idle Motion more than ever. We have been working on the Research and Development of 'Shooting with Light' since 2014, when we scratched our work at New Diorama, to great critical success. This enabled us to work out the story, methods of storytelling, visuals and music. We are now building on this and will finish creating a truly exceptional and original piece of theatre.

blurb1: A rogue-like sci-fi strategy survival game with base building, tactical combat, crew management and emergent storytelling.
title: Halcyon 6: Starbase Commander
reward_backer_tup:
LT. COMMANDER FIRST CLASS
 -- early bird --

CAPTAIN 
-- All Digital, Great for Int'l Backers! --
risk: Beyond catastrophes on a global scale ("the internet stops working forever", "the world is consumed by a black hole" or "zombies"), our game is going to be made.

That being said, game development is hard, and unexpected setbacks can fall on your head at any minute. We've been in the business long enough to know that servers can fail, funds can fall short and 3rd party delivery mechanism changes can sideline the plans of tiny and huge developers alike.

But we're a dedicated, scrappy group. We work long hours, fueled by the passion we have for this project. We have multiple devs on staff who have spent their entire professional lives designing and implementing highly complex systems similar to the ones we're building for roster management and event generation. Our front-end team is hard at work, and our combat prototype is ahead of schedule.

Thank you again for your interest and your support. All of us at Massive Damage can't wait to collaborate with all our backers on making Halcyon 6: Starbase Commander the awesome game we all want and deserve!

risk: Some of the biggest challenges that we experience as performing artists is being able to bring our artistic vision on stage while being able to bring all the other elements that are necessary for a stage production. That means, the only way this performance will have the space to develop, is if we can bring everything and everyone together to make it happen. From the performers, to the technical staff, to the audience members, all these elements need to combine to bring this project to life.

This production is not being put on stage with the purpose of obtaining any profit, but, if we do not obtain enough funds to cover its full cost, the show will not meet the professional requirements that are expected, and we might have to postpone it until we can gather enough funds.

blurb1: A Satirical Science Fiction Film about a man working for a personalized apology firm. Think "Her" meets "Up in the Air."
title: The Apology Service
risk: The creation of any film comes with a myriad of challenges and risks. Our film is no different.

We have the potential for risks such as not getting into all of the film festivals we will submit the Apology Service towards.  Though it can be disappointing not to make certain festivals, we will have a premiere of our own as well as distribution to the fans (you!) who want to see this film.

The largest risks rests on you.  Can you afford to support us, are the rewards you get in return, both physically and emotionally, worth it? We are trying to reach out and make the film making process as fun and exciting for you as it is for us.  To achieve this, we are offering fun incentives as well as showcasing our creative process as we work to get this film finished.
With that said, we promise to be responsible and take great care with the money you have trusted us with. We do not take that statement lightly.
As far as the rewards go, we will try to create them and get them out to you in a timely fashion. Some will go out at the onset. Others may not be created until the film is done.

Filming will be a challenge because we have to get every shot in our Seventeen page script filmed in six days.  It will be difficult, but we have the experience from our previous films to make this happen.

We will be raising funds during March and April and will begin shooting the first full week of May. We will contact you regarding the rewards that are film set specific roughly a few weeks before the filming begins.
We'll finish post production in November which is when we will have to submit it for our Senior Capstone Art Exhibition.  Expect to receive the finished film roughly around that time.
OTHER RULES:

• Set visitors will have to make their own travel arrangements. We CANNOT provide travel expenses or lodging. We will be shooting in Dahlonega, GA, mostly, but will have days shooting in Cleveland and Atlanta, Georgia.  We will try to keep you aware of when we will be filming in each location.
• You must be over 18 or accompanied by a parent or legal guardian to visit the set. Extras must also be over 18.
• We will try our best to make sure featured extras makes the final cut but there are no guarantees.
• Some rewards may require additional paperwork. If you are appearing in the film, you will have to sign a release, etc.
We hope the risks and challenges won't deter you from supporting and becoming part of the Apology Service Family!

risk: TWO GENIUS HUSBANDS is a difficult play linguistically. Having some funds to pay the actors will reinforce their commitment to a demanding text, but rehearsals are going to be tricky and mentally exhausting. However, we are confident that we can hire a cast who is as devoted to the play as we are. We have all tackled similar challenges in previous projects, and we know that we can create something of great artistic value with this production.

risk: Delicious is my fourth deck and my third Kickstarter campaign. My first two Kickstarter campaigns were successfully funded, and both had their rewards shipped on or ahead of schedule. Keeping everyone up to date and delivering on time are of utmost importance to me, and Delicious will not be an exception. Any unforeseen issues will be swiftly resolved.

blurb1: A short comedy about a slacker and his pathetic attempt to rob a convenience store.
title: Beat Him To It - A Short Film by Emerson College Students
risk: Considering our project deadline and the fact that we are shooting on film, we really only have one shot at this. To prepare for our one opportunity on capturing what we need, there are a lot of logistical processes we must complete. We must clear our stunts with the Director of Production Safety at Emerson, we must obtain the appropriate permits to shoot in our locations, we must rehearse with our cast so that we can get the perfect take in as few shots as possible, and we must afford our production costs.

Unfortunately, the quality of our production does not solely depend on our very talented crew. This project depends heavily on the budget, and as college students, paying out of our own pockets is difficult. That is why we created this page. We are sharing it with every friend, every family member, every friend's family member, and ever family member's friend.

Our deepest gratitude goes out to everyone who supports us. If you are unable to back us, please share our page. Any amount of exposure is definitely a form of support, and we will appreciate it greatly.

Thank you,
The Key Crew of "Beat Him To It"

risk: We've had one Kickstarter campaign before (June 2014), which helped us test the waters and see what complications we might run into.

This first campaign was for a card game, AlakaSLAM, where we ran into the issue that some copies of the game were missing the ball token; when we alerted the manufacturer, they were quick to send out the missing piece. 
We liked the quality and their quick response, and so we're considering using them for this print run. Our choice in manufacturer depends on the final size of the print run -- we’ll go with whichever company can get us the best quality components.

We've also been active in the gamemaking community, learning tips and tricks. We are part of the Gamemakers Guild
(http://www.gamemakersguild.com/wpgmg/). Clairvoyance is currently being considered for the Gamemakers Guild seal of approval. You can check out more of our work on www.eye4games.com.

risk: We are no strangers to the production process, and we know that it requires large amounts of planning and dedication. We will also be using sound engineers and production companies that are familiar with our group's sound, which helps to mitigate lengthy delays in the production process.

Our commitment and ambition has already led us to begin the recording process, and we have begun tracking several songs for the upcoming EP, which puts us to a very strong start.  We want to avoid the same delays and setbacks that came with our last album, and the experience learned from previous trials paired with the focus on a smaller project will allow us to zero in on working towards efficient completion.

blurb1: We are launching a new Outdoor Education and Environmental Sustainability program at our school!
title: High School Outdoor Education Pilot Trip
reward_backer_tup: Your name listed as a supporter of the MELS Outdoor Education & Environmental Sustainability program in the trip report.
Covers the cost of one student!  A digital copy of the trip report (with photographs), along with your name listed as a supporter.

A collection of printed photographs from the trip! MELS families will also receive a printed photograph of the Class of 2018 arriving at the summit of Bear Mountain. All donors will receive a copy of digital trip report and your name listed as supporter in the report.

Handwritten notes with printed photographs (including a photograph of the entire Class of 2018 on the summit for MELS families) from 9th graders sharing their experiences, along with the digital trip report and your name listed as supporter in the report.

A summit poster of the Class of 2018 at the summit (MELS families) or the view from the top (non-MELS families), signed by all students, along with the digital trip report and your name listed as supporter in the report.
risk: Much of this expedition ultimately requires the efforts of a dozen teachers, with varying degrees of expertise in planning and leading outdoor trips.  While roughly half of us are seasoned backpackers and have led wilderness trips, the sheer number of students promises that this will be an immense undertaking for all.

We thus anticipate that our greatest obstacle will be taking care of the multitude of logistical tasks, and doing so in a timely manner once the project is funded.  Our capacity to do this, even as we manage the day-to-day work at school, will be key to ensuring our entire community of staff, parents, and students feel prepared for this amazing experience.  In response to this, we have assembled a planning team that has met regularly since the start of the school year and will continue to do so.  As the project nears full funding, communication with the rest of the staff, students, and families has also been labeled a priority.

We also recognize that for students to have the best possible experience, they need to feel included and invested in the process.  This project, after all, is about our youth--not us as adults.  Teachers have already begun planning curriculum around the trip, and connecting learning from academic courses to this capstone experience.  Listening to student input, and allowing students to plan aspects of this journey, will also ensure that our entire freshmen class builds a committed and supportive community around this first-ever experience!

blurb1: With this classic instrument, Emily Jumes brings a timeless sound, to Fredericksburg Texas. Help her keep the sound alive!
title: "Harp on Main":  A tune-up for Fredericksburg's iconic harp
reward_backer_tup: A huge thank you to any donor at this amount! You’ll be posted and thanked on Fredericksburg Harp Studio's Facebook Page!
All of the above, plus a free DVD recording of the December Harp concert.
All of the above, plus recognition in the December Harp concert program.
All of the above, plus one free 30 minute harp lesson.
One in-home "David visit" (free December concert DVD, and program recognition.)
One in-home "David visit" plus one public domain song of your choice, performed and dedicated at the December Harp concert (free December concert DVD, and program recognition.)
One private concert for you and 15 other friends or family members, at the charming gazebo in downtown Fredericksburg. (Free December concert DVD, and program recognition.)

One private concert for you and 15 other friends or family members, at the charming gazebo in downtown Fredericksburg, and a special composition premiered and dedicated to you at the December Harp concert. (Free December concert DVD, and program recognition.)
risk: An obvious challenge with this project is the uncertain cost and extent of essential repairs. Does the harp need to be completely restored? Or does it merely need a tune-up? This cannot be finally determined until it is examined in Chicago. However, I have talked over these considerations with the 30-year Master Builder at Lyon and Healy, and he guarantees that the job will be done excellently for no more than this project's target amount.

Another variable is the amount of time that the makeover will take. Six months is the calculated maximum, but it is possible that the work could take longer. This will only delay my concert if I do not have the harp by mid November. Should this be the case, I will reschedule the performance for early 2016, and select a more season-generic program. While the harp is in Chicago I will be able to continue playing events with my smaller pedal harp, but will not be able to give large performances or start any recording.
I am confident that, with your help, I can see this project through to completion. And I am optimistic that the repairs will be minimal, and the end result will include an enjoyable album as well!

blurb1: An 8-member professional vocal ensemble on Boston’s South Shore, bringing great choral chamber music to intimate audiences and spaces.
title: Genesis Chamber Singers
reward_backer_tup: Listing in our debut concert program, if donation is received by March 21, 2015.
Free ticket to one of our concerts in May (value $25.00).
One free subscription to our 2015-16 concert season (four concerts, value $100).
The highest pledge at the end of the project (minimum $500) will have a piece of music composed for Genesis and dedicated to the award winner at a concert next season!
Genesis Chamber Singers will perform in your home (or office) for a private party of your closest friends and family. Date negotiable, repertoire might be as well!
risk: The most important element of a successful professional chamber music ensemble is the personnel, the musicians. Our eight singers are highly trained, excellent readers, with beautiful voices and engaging minds. Retention is important to establishing continuity and stability, so if a singer must drop out of the group, we'll need to replace him/her with someone equally qualified. That can be challenging, but there is a good network in our area.

Doing good work is just the start. If people don't know about what we're doing to change the way people think of chamber choral music, our impact will be slight at best. We'll need to get the word out, through social media, traditional media outlets, and good old fashioned networking. Managing our visibility and exposure will be important, especially as we head towards our first full concert season of 2015-16.

risk: Seven Seas has over ten years experience in the publishing industry, having released hundreds of volumes of manga and graphic novels over the years. Currently, Seven Seas releases about ten books per month, so we're used to meeting strict deadlines and are well-versed in the challenges that accompany production, manufacturing, shipping, etc. Space Dandy: Galactic Deck-Building Game is 100% complete, and has already been approved by the rights holders. Even though there is always the possibility of delays when dealing with third parties, we’re dedicated to honoring our commitments and making the best game possible.
